choices: The Tremaine Dress stops the Evil Queens ploy
Leon and the Evil Queen are transported to her kingdom
1153221122222111211121211221112222.content:
The Evil Queen left the room Tremaine was in and immediately snuck upstairs to where Leon was being held in his room and staring contemplatively at his reflection.

The Evil Queen entered quietly, “I can help you,” she said, startling Leon.

“Who are you?!” Leon asked on guard.

“I’m just a sympathetic soul that sees the injustice being done to you and wants to help you get out of these clothes and out of this nightmarish mansion- for good”

“You can help me get out? I won’t have to wear these dresses any more?!” Leon asked hopefully.

“Come with me, and you won’t have to wear THOSE dresses anymore” the Evil Queen said with Leon not recognizing the emphasis on the word “those”.

“What do I have to do?” Leon asked.

The Evil Queen ripped off a thin scarf she was wearing wrapped it around Leon’s neck, she then took a brooch off of herself and equipped it on Leon’s top.

“These will help extend my transportation powers to you,” she said as she equipped them onto him, “those look so nice on you,” she said passively.

The tone of this expression didn’t raise the suspicion nor even the attention from Leon that it probably should have. Nor did he find it suspicious that this presented escape plan required wearing more feminine items from a different animated dress. He was too attached to the idea of escape, and seriously, what were the odds that multiple entities would be so deadset on forcing him to look and dress like a woman?

“Now,” the Evil Queen said, “just hold onto to my sleeve and we’ll be out of here in no time, Lea” another warning sign that Leon didn’t notice as he grabbed her sleeve.

A breeze started to blow up from the floor, Leon felt uncomfortable as it was blowing up his dress. He tried to disregard it as all of this would all be over soon, he thought. He closed his eyes.

Just then....
1153221122222111211121211221112222.title: Sly trick

choices: The Evil Queen successfully abducts Leon
The two battle for the prize of Leon
11532211222221112111212112211122221.content:
When the Evil Queen left Tremaine, Tremaine was not nearly as trusting as she let the Queen believe.

She immediately had a couple stockings monitor her interactions that over heard the conversation between Leon and the Queen. Once it became clear that The Queen was going to try to take Leon away, the stockings reported back to Tremaine.

Leon was standing there holding the sleeve of the Queen, eyes closed and ignoring the air blowing up his dress when out of nowhere he felt something grab and pull his other hand. The gloves of the Tremaine Dress.

The breeze immediately stopped as he now found himself in a game of tug of war between the two dresses.

“You really thought I was going to let you take Lea away from me,” the Tremaine Dress said as she tried pulling him away.

“She will be of much more value in my kingdom.”

After every warning sign that Leon was able to overlook he finally picked up on that, he shot a stunned glance over to the Queen and then down at the scarf and brooch on him and winced, “She wasn’t going to set me free!” He thought, “she was going to use me in a similar fashion!”

Same Lea, Different Lame.

“She belongs here!” The Tremaine dress countered.

“It doesn’t matter where you think she belongs, she WILL end up in my reign”

“Even IF you were able to take her, I know where you live- I’ll get her back.”

“Fine you can try all you want. And if you were able to get her, I would reclaim her.”

Leon felt a sinking in his heart, escape and a return to his normal life already seemed like a daunting task with one magical army deadset on not letting him leave. How would he ever get back to his normal life when there were TWO whose apparent sole purpose was to keep him this way.

Then, the verbal feud, seemed to shift gears to where it seemed as though it was directed specifically at Leon.

“I’ve seen your ‘fortress’. She would escape your fortress with no problem. You would lose her.” The Tremaine Dress argued.

“You must have vision problems then,” the Evil Queen countered, “no one enters or leaves without my allowance. Meanwhile, she’s already escaped YOUR premises.”

“I allowed her to escape just recapture her. It was a GAME to me,” the Tremaine Dress said, “all a part of cementing her identity as Lea”

“I’d be able to cement her identity as Lea WITHOUT risking losing her.”

“There is NO risking losing her. There is no where she can go that is outside of my reach. There is nowhere she can hide that is outside of my view. She will never truly escape from me”

“My reach is vaster, my view is broader- she will never be able to truly escape from ME”

Leon still being pulled left and right stared out in despair over the thing they indirectly agreed upon: he would never be able to truly escape.

Now was as good a point as any for him to make his case, “Please...Stop this...I’m a man...”

The tug of war ceased momentarily as both Tremaine and the Evil Queen laughed heartily.

“Let it go, Lea” Tremaine laughed.

“I’ve never heard of a lady Jester,” the Evil Queen laughed.

Leon took this moment to escape their grasps and then the room.
11532211222221112111212112211122221.title: The Tremaine Dress stops the Evil Queens ploy

choices: The battle continues and Tremaine claims Leon
The battle continues and the Evil Queen claims Leon
As the battle occurs, Leon actually gets the key
115322112222211121112121122111222213.content:
Leon raced down the stairs and towards the front door to get away from these crazy haunted outfits. Right as he was about to reach it. A white elbow length glove shot down and locked the door with a key and did some magic trick to make the key disappear.

“Oh, come on!” Leon yelled. Just then a dark purple elbow length glove appeared next to the white one. Both appeared to acknowledge Leon before looking back at the other. They both assaulted him, ripping his outfit off of him in some mutual but combative struggle to strip him.

“What the hell is going on?” He yelled, just before Lady Tremaine and the Evil Queen exited the his quarters they were all just in. The Evil Queen waved her arm in the air just before manifesting a dark purple mini-skirt, black stockings, a black blouse, and black high heels.

Lady Tremaine witnessed this and summoned a white blouse, a shiny golden mini-skirt, yellow leggings, and gold colored high heels.

Both outfits had an odd glow to them, and as they approached him he assumed that it an indication for victory for Tremaine or the Queen. Confirmed by when the Evil Queen yelled out, “You want out Lea, just put on that outfit.” Tremaine combatted it with, “You have it good here, Lea. We have rapport put on the gold outfit.”

“What’s with these colors?” Leon asked, “Do you guys think this is some battle of good versus evil? Because there’s definitely no ‘good’ side. AND MY NAME IS LEON!”

“Now is hardly the time for joke, Lea” Tremaine responded.

“Come on, Lea! Let’s get you out of here!” The Evil Queen yelled.

Just then, Leon felt a pull on his neck to see the scarf the the Evil Queen has placed on him earlier, that hadn’t been removed when the gloves stripped him. It began pulling him into the air towards the purple outfit while it approached him as well.

“No! Stop it!” He yelled wrestling in futility at the scarf drawing him towards the outfit. The purple blouse separated from the outfit and placed itself around Leon’s torso. The brooch from his last outfit levitated into the air and equipped itself on the blouse.

Tremaine saw this and summoned more articles of clothing to pull him away from this dressing. Once back on the ground the articles started tugging at the blouse while the leggings from the gold outfit swallowed Leon’s legs.

Leon has thought the tug of war from earlier was demeaning, but this dressing battle was gearing up to be much more humiliating.

The Evil Queen materialized a plethora of black articles of clothes into the room as Leon witnessed the disappearing key from earlier floating around the opposite side of the room.

“That’s the only outcome that I could possibly want” Leon said to himself.

Tremaine and the Evil Queen each brought more and more articles of clothing into the battle and Leon soon saw a complete pandemonium as the white and gold articles were fighting with the black and purple articles in their pursuit of Leon.
115322112222211121112121122111222213.title: The two battle for the prize of Leon

1153221122222111211121211221112222132.content:
Leon, dressed only in the purple blouse, yellow leggings and black scarf tries to cautiously make his way across the room for the key. In his first couple steps, he gets tripped up and looks down to see the black heels have placed themselves on his feet over the gold colored leggings.

“How is that even supposed to work?” Leon yells frustrated, you’ll have to come off with the leggings if that’s even going to work!”

He continues to stumble with a greater degree of caution, due to the heels, across the room.

He makes it a quarter of the way when the blouse is ripped off of his body by some of tremaines army. A third of the way, the heels hop off his feet and hook his wrists, lifting him up in the air so some black gloves can rip off his leggings. The heels then fly him back to the wall opposite of the key and drop him maliciously to the ground. Before he can get up, the heels fly back onto his feet.

“Geez, if you both want me so bad- perhaps you could not damage me up in the process of abducting me!”

He continued his plight of making his way to the key. Articles of clothing applying themselves on him, then getting ripped off. In the course of twenty minutes his outfit had been mixed up in a countless number of ways while he was constantly knocked back, dropped, slapped and crudely stripped. Each time he was separated from the key- it felt further away and more greatly unattainable.

“I just have one thing to get...how is it more likely that either of these crazy outfits will win over me?”

He was getting so discouraged he almost wanted to give up, given the implausibility of his getting that key- the only thing that forced him to try again was the reminder of what was at stake- the reminder literally ruthlessly flying right at him from a variety of angles.

After 20 minutes he found his second wind, he uttered to himself, “No! This will NOT be my life!” And he strode bravely across the room. A quarter of the way, a third of the way, halfway. The articles flying around the room doing everything from pushing him back to snapping his bra straps and panty bands.

His mantra kept him pushing toward, three quarters of the way across the room, and then all the way across the room till the key was right in from of him.

He took a moment to take pride in his accomplishment and salvation as he extended his hand to grab the key. His hand was just about to collapse itself around the key when...

BAM!

He was immediately dog-piled by a bunch of dark fabric and its tackled him to the ground. The peace of the collapse was short lived as the things that were momentarily on top of him instantly juxtaposed themselves all around him.

When the motion stopped, he lifted himself up from the collapse and looked across the room at all the articles of clothes now laying motionless around the room. He then nervously looked himself over to see, with horror and disgust, the black and purple outfit completely assembled on his body. The scarf and brooch lifted itself up from the corner of the room and flew without obstruction towards Leon and placed themselves onto his completed outfit without any fight from Leon- still defeated from his near victory.

The Evil Queen flew down to join Leon. “Ah, Lea! I had no doubt in my mind that you would be mine. We’re going to do great things together! More than just this petty modeling. The world will know you as Lea- one of the most influential women ever.”

“The world will know you as Lea” echoed in his mind, adding to his plummeting defeat.

“Don’t worry, Lea” Tremaine declared, “We’re not giving up on you! It’s not over yet!”

“It’s never over...” Leon said sadly.

The Evil Queen grabbed Leon, that familiar breeze from below returned, and shortly after the mansion around him disappeared.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132.title: The battle continues and the Evil Queen claims ...

11532211222221112111212112211122221321.content:
The magic tunnel was a wormhole of women’s clothes- dresses, gowns, skirts, lingerie, there was even a wedding dress that kept making an appearance throughout the high-speed journey through. All of this further disappointed Leon.

The Evil Queen even mentioned, “everything you see in this tunnel is available to you, Lea”. The tone of her voice suggested that Leon should feel honored by this declaration.

“Man, why couldn’t I have stumbled onto a magic society of high quality suits, instead?” Leon mumbled under his breath, “why did it have to be women’s clothing? And why on Earth did it have to be ME?!”

Deeper into the tunnel the clothes lining the tunnel seemed to be attracted to Leon, they would so swiftly slide from their place as a makeshift wall to graze across Leon as he was flying by. Fingertips, his stockinged legs, his face, and tussling his hair- each time the clothing touched him he would flinch and mutter “stop it” and “cut it out”. They didn’t.

Throughout the journey, Leon kept wondering where he went wrong in all of this. Obviously, he wished he had just left the mansion the moment he walked in to save himself from all of this- but how was he to know that those dresses would choose to become intertwined into his life and forever altering his destiny to this? How could he have foreseen that the clothes would be alive much less that they would have an unrelenting insistence on him wearing them, lesser so that this desire would extend throughout the entire world of living women’s clothes(despite the fact that it was Tremaine that encouraged this latest escalation, which Leon didn’t know about).

Where did Leon make a wrong decision? Obviously, looking back on everything, he didn’t take this whole thing as seriously as he should have- but how was he to know that things would escalate THIS much. Perhaps, when he was allowed to leave the mansion he should have been certain that nothing ragged along, in hindsight it was very suspicious that they would just let him leave after keeping him trapped in the mansion- but how was he to know that they’d let him go just to force him back?

Then Leon wondered, was this even avoidable in the first place? If he had made different decisions would it have even led to different circumstances? Was there ANY decision he could have made that wouldn’t have led to him being forced to wear women’s clothes? At this point of time he doubted it. His pessimism was so strong that he suspected he was invited to the mansion solely for this purpose. He believed that he could have refused on any and all accounts to even step foot in the mansion and he probably would have been kidnapped and stranded in that damned mansion, or he would have been framed in some crime and forced to live under house arrest in that mansion- all of this just so this could happen.

Leon didn’t know if any of his thoughts made sense, he was just still sour about having the key right in his hand only to be blind-sided by this outfit he was now wearing and forced to accept all the following consequences. This so shortly after that incident in the hotel room. Would he ever be able to be Leon again?
11532211222221112111212112211122221321.title: The journey to the castle

115322112222211121112121122111222213211.content:
The tunnel ended with a purple light that both the Evil Queen and Leon entered.

The exit to the tunnel spit Leon crashing through the doors of an Armoire and falling face first onto the ground before it.

The Evil Queen followed Leon by floating smoothly out of the furniture and making a soft, smooth landing right next to him.

“You’re going to have to work on your exit for that.”

“These clothes had no trouble flying to put themselves on me, they could have at least done the same to prevent me from this,” Leon complained.

“Perhaps if you hadn’t fought so hard not to wear them, they would have” The Evil Queen gloated.

Leon looked back to see what he was fired out of to see the Armoire that held his newest wardrobe. “What in the Narnia is that?”

“It’s neat, isn’t it?” The perk of our kingdom is that we have a magical pipeline to every woman’s wardrobe all across the world.

“Great...”

“It IS great! We have access to any clothes you can possibly imagine!”

“Anything from the men’s department?”

“Whatever for?” The Evil Queen laughed, “but seriously, that’s outside of our jurisdiction.”

“Of course...”
115322112222211121112121122111222213211.title: Arriving at the castle

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Leon immediately began trying to plot his way back home(in case getting back home would serve any purpose since both the Evil Queen and Tremaine swore to find him and collect him wherever he goes).

“So, where am I?” Leon asked.

“Samara Castle,” the Evil Queen answered.

“Samara Castle?! But that’s a real place, I’ve heard of it on the news!”

“Of course it’s a real place,” The Evil Queen scoffed, “you think I transported you to a video game?”

“Not one I’ve ever played before,” Leon answered, “ but there’s actually people here. Royal Family and whatnot!”

Leon got excited, if there were people here then maybe he wouldn’t entirely be at the mercy of these clothes. Perhaps humanity could come together and save him from his supernatural predicament!

“Ha!” She responded, “it’s all smoke and mirrors. We’re the power behind the throne, and the throne is a bunch of actors- except for you.”

“Except for me?”

“Well, we need a face for the public- our PR department has said that showing people that their country is ran by living clothes is a bad look. That’s where you come in.”

“What is this now?”

“You’re going to be our princess. Our delightful and relatable face for the public”

“That’s not going to work,” Leon laughed, relieved to be able to foil their plan, “I can’t be your ‘princess’ if I’m not already part of the royal family....so there isn’t a good reason for me to” The Evil Queen expressively cleared her throat in the middle of Leon’s gloating and pointed behind him,” ...be...here...” he concluded following the Queens finger behind him to see a wedding gown floating right behind him.

“You have got to be kidding me...” he said. He reflected on his question “where did I go wrong?” From the tunnel. Apparently he went wrong by chasing his own freedom instead of electing to stay with Tremaine. And that was a hard pill to swallow...
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: “Where am I?”

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“There is no way on Earth that I’m going to-“ the wedding gown immediately began pulling at the clothes Leon was wearing, “hey! Cut that out!” It didn’t, “I think I’ve experienced enough of this in the past hour,” Apparently he hadn’t, “Stop it! I swear! STOP IT!”

And so the wedding dress continued to strip Leon until, once again he was just in his bra and panties, before it began climbing onto him and zipping itself up.

“Come on, Lea. Be cooperative- doesn’t Princess Lea have a nice ring to it?”

“I’M NOT LEA! MY NAME IS LEON! FOR THE LAST TIME I’M NOT A WOMAN I’M A MAN!”

“If only that WOULD be the last time.”

“Why are you doing this? Why are you and Tremaine doing this? Aren’t there plenty of women out there that would LOVE to be a model? That would LOVE to be a princess? Why can’t you grab one of the women that actually want that life instead of shoving ME into it?”

“Why would we go looking for someone else when we already have you?”

“You don’t have to go looking for someone! I know people! Women! I know women PERSONALLY that would be here by sundown that would LOVE this opportunity.”

“I suppose we COULD use a Maid of Honor!”

“NO! They could be the BRIDE! THEY could be the princess! Hell, I’LL be the maid of honor so long as I don’t have to be the bride.”

“Do you want to be the maid of honor?”

“I do. Definitely! Especially over being the bride.”

The Evil Queen cleared her throat, “do you take this man to be your husband?”

“What?”

She then pulled out a tape recorder and hit play, Leon then heard his own voice saying “I do. Definitely.”

Leon stared at the tape aghast.

“Like I said, Lea, smoke and mirrors.”

“I’m not Lea...”

“I knew it wouldn’t be the last time.” She teased and then approached Leon, “you need to understand something...you ARE Lea.” She lifted Leon’s chin up to bring his gaze up to where her face would have been, “maybe you weren’t Lea before. Maybe you were and just didn’t know it. That’s irrelevant. Because all that matters is right now and the future. And right now, you ARE Lea, and tomorrow you WILL be Lea. And every consecutive day after you WILL be Lea. No matter what you do or where you go- you will be Lea forever and ever until the end of time.”

Leon, forced to look at the Evil Queens non-existent face, started to tear up, “That’s not true...” he pleaded, “I’ll escape...I’ll get away...somewhere you and Tremaine can’t get me...”

“No.” The Evil Queen said, not laughing not teasing but almost sounding sympathetic, “you’ve got an hour before you have to be at the reception quarters. Take the time to look in the mirror and accept your new station in life, Lea. Our actor will wait outside your door to lead you there. Go willingly, or we’ll drag you there. Your choice. But you’re getting married today, Princess.”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Before the wedding

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content: Will he be successful?

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Leon recognized the validity of what the Evil Queen said, even if he miraculously escaped both of them, he would always have them on his tail to pull him back into of “Lea” in some form or another, but he refused to sacrifice his self and his identity just to make their lives easier.

“No,” Leon said looking sternly at his bridal reflection,, “I’m not going to just ALLOW this to be my life. There has to be a way out.”

Outside of the door, there was someone waiting for him to take him to his wedding, so that would be risky.

Thinking a little bit he figured- what better than the way I came in?

He opened the door to the women’s armoire and looked at all the dresses hanging up in there.

“I hope this works,” he said, “here goes nothing...”

He then dove into the wardrobe, and...

choices: In the brides maids changing room

choices: They escort him to the reception
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Much to his relief he actually found himself shooting through a similar wormhole to the one that brought him to the castle. He had no control or knowledge of navigating his way through this, but surely wherever he ended up would be much better than where he was.

He looked back to see that purple light get further and further behind him. Finally something was going his way.

As he traveled through the tunnel, he thought he heard gasps and growls from around him which felt peculiar, but perhaps those sounds were always there and he didn’t notice it when the Evil Queen was taking to him.

Then out of nowhere, one of the sleeves of the dresses wrapped around his arm and stopped him in his momentum.

“What the-?!” Leon exclaimed as more and more clothes lining the wormhole reached out and haphazardly grabbed him, “what are you doing?!”

The clothes holding onto to Leo rotated him almost 180 degree while Leon fearfully saw the purple light he just escaped from. “No no please no” Leon pleaded shaking his head.

Almost as though they granted his wish, the clothes lining the tunnel rearranged themselves walling off the old light and revealing a new tunnel with a new light, the clothes then pulled him back before launching him towards that new light.

Once he pulled himself off the ground, he felt dismayed by seeing all the women in brides maids dresses.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: In the brides maids changing room

choices: The bridesmaids forcefully escort him to the wedding
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“Women!” Leon immediately thought, “actual women! If they have actual women at hand, why do they need me for this?”

“Wow! You really know how to make an entrance!” One of the women told you, “you must be the new princess! Nice to meet you, I’m Rebecca!”

“You must be one happy lady being selected to be the new princess! I know it’s every little girls dream to be a princess! I’m Sandra, by the way!”

“Rebecca! Sandra! You’ve got to help me! I don’t want to get married, I don’t want to be a princess, I’m a man!”

Instead of the support you were hoping for, you instead got laughter.

“Ah, isn’t that the way the cookie crumbles?” Rebecca joked.

“Always a bridesmaid, never a bride. But what can you do when the bride is a guy?” Sandra recited.

“Is that a limerick?” Leon exclaimed shocked at their passivity, “aren’t you going to help me?”

“What do you want us to do?” Sandra laughed.

“Help me get this wedding dress off, for starters! Switch places with me! One of YOU can be the princess, since you want it so bad. Or both of you, I don’t care, as long as it’s not ME!”

Both of the women laughed again.

“What’s so funny?!” Leon yelled.

“Honey,” Rebecca said, “You’re not getting it.”

“What?”

“It’s not like we’re not the ones getting married to the prince because they didn’t know about us. Because they did. And it’s not like we didn’t want to, because we do.” Rebecca explained.

Leon looked at her frantically puzzled.

“They didn’t want us,” Sandra continued, “They apparently wanted you. And that’s where we’re at”

“But I don’t want it!”

“Well, did you TELL them that you didn’t want it?” Sandra asked.

“YES! YES! A million times YES!”

“And how did that work out for you?” She asked as an argument and letting her eyes drift over your outfit as a means of further making her point.

And then...
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: A word with the maids

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“Well,” Rebecca said, “it’s showtime”

Rebecca and Sandra stand on each side of Leon and grab his elbow and begin pulling him out of the room.

“Wait! No! Stop!” Leon pleaded, “Don’t do this!”

They ignored his pleas and drug him all the way to the reception hall. The doors opened to reveal a packed house of attendees, camera crews and a man standing in a tux at the front.

“Wait,” Leon nervously exclaimed, “what’s with all these cameras?”

“It’s a Royal Wedding,” Sandra laughed, “this is being broadcast live all over the world.”

“The entire world is going to see me like this?!”

“This is a big deal,” Rebecca answered, “not only will you be famous, you’ll be immortalized in the history books.”

“Oh please no,” Leon squirmed unable to break away from his bridesmaids.

Once they got to the front, they whispered “make this easier for all of us and don’t try anything”

The groom stood before Leon smiling, Leon tried to warn him away, “I’m a man, you know that right”

“I’ve heard,” he said behind an actors smile, “can’t help ya. I signed up for a gig for twenty dollars two years ago, and now I’m trapped in this role. Once we get this thing over with maybe I won’t be needed so much”

—
The wedding went off without a hitch, especially thanks to good video production. All of Leon’s fidgeting and reluctance were cut out, the tape the Evil Queen played dubbed in. And in short order, the entire world was aware of Princess Lea.

Leon’s cousin, Katie, tuned in to watch the historic event- and at a close up of the princess’s face she paused the stream and inspected it.

“Is that...Leon...?”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: The bridesmaids forcefully escort him to the we...

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Katie was certain that her eyes deceived her. Despite the nagging feeling in the back of her mind swearing “that’s him! That HAS to be him!” Her more rational mentality knew there was no possible way that her male cousin was now the princess of Samara.

Despite not talking to his cousin for the past couple months, she was close with him. Perhaps a reason for this hiatus in communication with him was because she was upset that her mother offered him to stay at the mansion instead of her. Sure it was a petty thing to get mad at someone for, and he didn’t- to her knowledge- advocate for the offer to given to him instead of her; but rent is expensive. Especially for her tiny little studio apartment.

She shook the idea out of her head. “It’s crazy!” She told herself, “impossible really” and she went on with her day. However, throughout the day the idea just kept coming back to her. “It’s him! It’s him! It’s him!”

Finally, she felt compelled to prove herself wrong. “You know what?” I’m just going to call him and get this over with.

The phone didn’t ring, it went directly to voicemail, “Hey Leon! It’s Katie! Sorry we haven’t spoken in a while, I’ve been...busy... Anyway! How’s it going?! How’s everything at your new home?! I’ll bet it’s awesome! Hey! Real quick! Have you seen the new princess of Samara? You’re going to call me crazy, but she looks just like you! The resemblance is uncanny! Anyway...call me back when you get this. I miss you!”

She hung up the phone.

Throughout the day she’d find herself glancing between her phone and the paused image of the princess’s face.

“It couldn’t be...” she thought, “it’s impossible...but why hasn’t he called back?”

To her astonishment, she realized that she was getting excited over the notion that that COULD be him.

“That’s crazy! Why do I want that to be him so bad?” She asked herself. Her mind immediately jumped to him being invited to live in the mansion again. “Oh that’s silly! That wasn’t even his doing. Besides, it’s not important- because there’s no way that that is him!” She assured herself.

A couple more hours went by and her phone still didn’t ring, while the nagging thoughts still poked at her.

“This is ridiculous!” She said, “I’m just going to go to that mansion, I’m going to see that he’s there- having a great time living it up and we can put this matter to bed”

She grabbed her phone and her keys and immediately head out to visit Leon at his mansion.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Katie visits the new princess

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
It was a two and a half hour drive till Katie pulled into the mansions driveway. It was even bigger than she thought it was. The pictures she had seen hasn’t done it justice- it was huge.

She began knocking at the door, when Tremaine’s voice came in from the intercom, “How might we be able to assist you?”

“Wow! I didn’t think anyone else lived here,” Katie explained stunned, “I’m Leon’s cousin- the person that’s living here and taking care of the property. Is he around?”

“Leon...I’m not familiar with a ‘Leon’. We did have a girl here that insisted her name was Leon. Perhaps you’re looking for Lea?”

Katie’s eyes grew wide as her face reflected a stunned excitement, she gathered herself together just to confirm “‘Lea’? As in ‘Princess Lea’?”

There was a moment of silence from the intercom, “and you said you were her cousin?”

“Yes, I am her cousin” she smiled.

A buzz emitted from the door, “Come in,” came from the intercom.

—-

Katie walked into the common quarters to find a floating dress waiting for her, “please have a seat, Katie.”

“Whoa! Are you a ghost?!” She exclaimed.

“I am a magic being that runs the happenings in this estate. Again, please sit and I will tell you everything. I’ll let you know right from the start. I need your help.”

Katie did, and Tremaine told her everything that happened to Leon: the dress modeling, the escape, the evil queen, the battle over him, and ending on him being transported to Samara.

Katie’s eyes were almost as big as her smile. “Leon is the new princess of Samara!” She thought, “I knew it!”

“Wow,” Katie responded to Tremaine, “that’s quite a series of events. What help did you need from me?”

“We need you to help bring her back.”

“How am I supposed to do that?”

Tremaine snapped her fingers and the gold and white outfit from the battle flew out and floated in air beside Tremaine. “We just need you to get this outfit on her, and then she will be pulled through a nearby mirror back to our estate.”

Katie smiled while biting her bottom lip imagining her cousin in such a feminine outfit.

“How am I supposed to get that on him,” Katie corrected herself, “Sorry- on HER”

“You just need to get her alone. It should be easy since you’re family. Just make sure there are no guards or closets around and then whistle twice- the outfit will take care of it from there. Don’t worry, we’ll provide a second outfit for you so that you can come through the mirror with her.”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Katie meets Tremaine

choices: The Evil Queen discovers Leon’s missing
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
The Evil Queen has told Leon that he wasn’t merely going to exist as a princess of their kingdom. “It’s important that our princess be a paragon of sophistication, culture and eloquence. That’s why I’m going to demand that you learn how to dance.”

Little did Leon know that by “dance” she meant ballet. For a week straight he was pulled from his bed at 4 am, cleaned, and shoved into a tutu

“I thought these outfits were normally saved for the performance,” Leon said when he was shoved into the ridiculous outfit that first morning.

“When you’re a princess, your entire life is a performance,” the Evil Queen said.

The all-day dance sessions left Leon too exhausted to even THINK about figuring a way out of this life he was shoved into.

“It can’t last forever,” Leon thought to himself, “I just have to endure this stuff and then I’ll make a run for it when they’re not looking.” Obviously it would require a bit more strategy, but keeping his mind on his next escape attempt made his circumstance easier to chew.

On the ninth day, one of the staff burst into the dance studio, “Princess Lea! You have company! She says she’s family.”

Leon got defensive and looked around the room for something to cover his outfit up with, but saw his company had already been allowed in the room. Instinctively, upon seeing Katie, he futilely tried to cover up his body with his hands.

Katie approached him wearing a long coat and a large purse on her elbow. Once she got closer to him, she looked him up and down and chuckled a little bit but with an air of sympathy.

“What...HAPPENED to you?” She played dumb.

Leon changed his covering strategy from covering his body with his arms to pulling the frills of his tutu down over his crotch.

“It’s a crazy story,” he said, “you wouldn’t possibly believe it. I’m not sure I do. But it’s hard not to, given the circumstances” he sadly laughed. “How did you find me?”

“I saw the wedding and I immediately knew it was you.”

“Oh right...of course.”

“Do you think we could speak in private?” Katie asked nodding back to the staff still standing at alert by the door.

“Could you give us a moment, please?” Leon yelled out.

“Certainly, Your Highness” before leaving and closing the doors.

“Katie, you’ve got to help me” Leon burst out still holding his tutu down as far as it will go, “I don’t want any of this- I don’t even know why any of this happened, but in every step of the way everything has just been like ‘this MUST happen’ and I try to ask why and no one’s giving me an answer. Like first it’s one group that deems it necessary to shove me in dresses and then out of nowhere this second party comes and agrees, but decides to take it a step further. It’s not that it’s a role that needs to be filled by someone, it’s a role that needs to be filled by ME, and I just don’t understand it.”

“Uh huh,” Katie responded not paying attention to Leon’s emotional rant, instead just looking around the room. Mirror-check. No closet-check. She began unzipping her purse.

“Please, Katie. Please tell me you’ll help me! I don’t know how much further this will go. I’m getting the feeling they’re trying to overwrite my identity to the point where- even IF I were to escape and return to my normal life people will only recognize me as ‘Lea’”

“Don’t worry, Lea” Katie said, “I’ll get you out of here.”

Leon felt stunned and began stepping back from her, “why did you call me that?”

Katie dropped her purse on the ground and removed her coat to reveal an outfit unmistakably from the Tremaine Line.

“Oh no! You’ve met Tremaine...”

Katie whistled twice and the outfit from that humiliating battle popped up from her purse and approached Leon.

“Don’t worry, we’ll get you back home,” Katie smiled.

In a series of events that should have felt routine to Leon(but didn’t) he was stripped and reoutfitted in the clothes that Katie brought. The clothes, acting of their own accord, lifted Leon up into the air and flew him right into the mirror.

Katie picked up the coat she stripped off and shoved it into the purse, she then walked over to the outfit pulled off of Leon and put that in her purse too.

She then comfortably walked over to the mirror and climbed in.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Meanwhile, back with Leon

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Leon, once again, found himself colliding to the ground after being shot out of the mirror. He was followed by Katie who gently stepped out and over him.

“Welcome back, Lea!” Tremaine cheerfully greeted him, “Katie! Good work on bringing her back, it’s far from over. The Evil Queen will certainly do everything she can to get her back. Not to mention Lea’s proclivity for trying to leave the premises just to make things difficult for us...would you be interested in being Lea’s caretaker to make sure she stays here where she belongs?”

“It would be my honor,” Katie confidently said, “Lea won’t go anywhere on my watch.”

“Katie,” Leon pleaded, “why are you going along with this?”

Katie knelt down next to Leon, “When was the last time we talked? A couple months ago. I don’t want us to be that distant again, but now we get to stay in touch EVERY DAY.”

“We can stay in touch without forcing me to be this way. Help me get back home, we can be roommates, we can talk everyday- I swear”

“But, Lea...you’re ALREADY home and we’re ALREADY roommates, and we WILL talk everyday!”

“It doesn’t have to be this way...” Leon continued to plead.

“From my perspective, it absolutely does.”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Back at the mansion

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“You can’t do this!” Leon screamed as he was shoved into another one of Tremaine’s dresses, “if I appear in any future ads the Queen will know exactly where I am. The WORLD will know where I am. They’ll suspect I’ve been abducted!”

“Settle down, Princess,” Tremaine scoffed, “now is the time we MUST do this. Your profile has never been higher, we’re going to sell A LOT of dresses when we’ve got the Princess of Samara. If the world suspects anything untoward, what are they going to do? Fly here and somehow find this mansion? Don’t make me laugh. Furthermore, the Queen probably knew you were gone the moment you came through that mirror. She won’t get here, though. We’ve protected our closets from her magic and she’s going to have a hard time getting here. Now...let’s see a sexy pose”

The outfit manipulated Leon’s position to give Tremaine what she wanted. Leon grimaced at how he was being manipulated while also appreciating it for not being ballet.

“You look great, Lea!” Katie affirmed. Leon sneered as a response.

“Don’t you think Katie might make a better model?” Leon pleaded.

“I don’t believe in mixing role, Lea. Katie’s the caretaker, you’re the star. We can’t put that kind of pressure on her.”

“Why don’t we switch roles?” Leon suggested as his body was pulled into a different camera-friendly position.

“That would just be a nightmare of contract and pay negotiations. We can’t put that kind of pressure on ME!”

“You’re not even paying me!”

“So you see where I’m coming from!”

“...are you paying Katie...?”

“That’s confidential, but yes”

“Don’t worry about the details, Lea” Katie assured you, “it’s not like you’ll ever be in a scenario where you’ll actually spend money!”

Just then Leon’s tutu from the palace floated out of Katie’s purse and floated in the middle of all three, obstructing the camera.

Leon shot a startled and annoyed glance back and forth between Katie and the ballerina outfit.

“What did you bring that for?” Leon moaned.

Tremaine faces Katie, “you brought that?!”

The outfit began spinning vertically in midair when a purple light began to glow. The Evil Queen soon after exited from that light, laughing.

“I’m sorry, Tremaine! She just looked so cute in it! I had no idea!”

“We do like to stay topical, don’t we?” The Evil Queen laughed. “I hope your new marketing campaign pays off, but it’s going to be the last one with THIS model. Come on, Lea. Get back in your tutu, we’ve got lost time to make up for.”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: The Return of the Queen

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“Wait!” Katie yelled. Leon looked at her in curiosity. Was she now going to, in some way fight for his interests? Granted, it’s very small, but it’s a start. It would be easier to find a way out from being a model, than both.

“What is it, you petty thief?”

“This feud between you two is more trouble than beneficial. What do you gain by being territorial with Lea? Pedantic victory in a never ending struggle? And what do you lose? Tremaine loses a model, misses out on sales, and the Queen loses a significant public figure. All the more, this division leaves more cracks that she can slip through.”

Leon grew pale with fear with suspense wondering where his cousin was going with this.

“What are you suggesting?” Tremaine asked curiously.

“Why don’t you two just share her?” Katie asked.

Leon nearly fainted with dread. It was bad enough being one of the other, but now both?

“Think about it, between the mirrors and the wardrobes there wouldn’t be any real time lost. There’s plenty of time in the day for it. And the more things occupying her time the less time she has to sneak her way out.” Katie said shooting a smile at Leon.

“You know,” Tremaine pondered, “I COULD use my new found spare time to increase my home security...”

“Great!” Katie chirped, “what do you say, Queen?”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Katie has an idea

choices: What if the driver didn’t recognize him?
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
After the Queen accepted the offer to “share Lea” Katie was right- Leon barely had any time to plan any escapes, but that didn’t stop him when the opportunity presented itself.

The first escape attempt happened in Samara. He ducked out of his shower and quietly slipped out of the castle naked- the only clothes at his disposal were women’s clothes and he couldn’t risk them overriding his will and dragging him back to the castle.

He snuck out and found some discard a bag of clothes after cleaning out their closet or something. He slipped on the clothes- they were tight, but they were men’s clothes it was the first time in what had to have been a year that he was wearing proper clothes. He grimaced at the notion that he’d been forced to be Lea for so long. This made him take this attempt all the more seriously, wondering how much longer he’d have to be Lea if this attempt didn’t work. He knew how long THEY wanted him for. Forever.

He left the village and soon found himself in the middle of nowhere and wondering how to get back home. Did he even have a home anymore? It was worth checking.

After traveling down long enough he felt it was safe to try and hitchhike.

It wasn’t.

At first the driver seemed to be helpful- until the middle of the drive when he was asked “you look really familiar, do I know you from somewhere?”

“I assure you that you don’t,” Leon quickly answered.

“Are you sure?” The driver asked, “what did you say your name was?”

“Leon. And you couldn’t, I’m just visiting- which is why I need to get back to the airport.”

The driver whispered it to himself, “Leon...Leon...Leon...” while glancing back at him, “Le...Ah!”

Leon shot a glance at him in suspense, “I finally got it! You’re Princess Lea!”

“No! That’s not true! I’m not!”

“You actually had me fooled!” The driver laughed, “you actually look like a man!”

“I AM a man!” Leon yelled.

The driver laughed, “Please, Princess...Royalty shouldn’t be out by her selves in the common world. It’s not safe. Let’s get you back to the palace.”

“No!” Leon yelled.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: A summary of Leon’s escape attempts

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
After that last escape attempt Leon learned that escape from Samara would be a futile endeavor. Unfortuately, the Queen and Tremaine discussed this attempt And worked to make sure their keep didn’t have any holes. Two years later, after making Leon be Lea for three years now- another opportunity arose- this time in Tremaines mansion.

There was a fire in the kitchen that drew the attention of the entire staff to deal with it. Leon, once again, stripped out of his outfit and quickly tip-toed to where he saw Tremaine kept the keys. He quickly snuck to the garage left unattended in response to the commotion in the kitchen. He hopped into the car and drove naked to his old house. It was left vacant. Three years. It was like salvation to see it.

When he was sure no one was around, he crept out of his car and snuck around to the back yard to bust out a window and climb in.

The power was shut off, but everything was right where he had left it. He ran to his bedroom and slipped into his old clothes from before this whole mansion ordeal. Three years, he reflected- but at last he was in his REAL home regardless of what Katie and Tremaine tried to say. At last he was finally HOME!

—-
The next morning, he had to fight against his strict routine that had been drilled into him. Which had always been two hours of ballet when he first woke up.

“No,” Leon told himself, “You don’t have to do that anymore, Lea- erhm- Leon”

He cringed at the slip up, but it has been three years- he just needs to rinse that old environment out of his system.

He eventually succumbed to 30 minutes of ballet just to shake off his unease.

Once he took care of of his water and electricity he hopped in the shower to clean himself off. It was symbolic in him washing his old life away. He got out to brush his teeth. Wiped the mirror off with his hand and began brushing, occasionally stopping to admire his true masculine reflection, “hello there Leon! You’re the MAN!”

He’d do this, spit, do it again, spit.

Then when he raised his head up one time, he didn’t see his reflection- he saw the inside of the mansion he just got out of. He rubbed his eyes, fearful he was having a hallucination, but the vision persisted.

“Wait...no!” Leon yelled when it finally clicked. Just then articles of Tremaine brand clothes began shooting through Leon’s mirror.

“No! Get away from me!” He yelled as they began tanking off his clothes. He fought them off as much as he could, but with each passing second more clothes came through the mirror to assist. It was only a short while later when Leo was naked, and an even shorter while after that till Leon was once again dressed as Lea and being pulled through the mirror back to the mansion he had escaped.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Escape attempt #2

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“Wow,” Tremaine exclaimed, “three years, and you’re still trying to leave. I feel sorry for you. If you weren’t so beautiful- I’d let you. Good looks really ARE a curse, no?”

Leon has learned: “no mirrors” it was a foolish mistake in the hopes that he could ever go back to his old life. He couldn’t. They made good on their promise to track him down.

That still didn’t mean he had to accept life as Lea.

“You’ve taught us,” Tremaine continued, “that we’re not to let our guard down for even one moment.”

And they didn’t. Leon was blocked at every attempt for 5 years after his last failed escape. Now 8 years being forced to be Lea.

Leon set up a wild contraption of misdirection. That would wake the entire staff but lead them to a different part of the house than the part he was trying to escape from.

It worked like a charm.

Leon, with his escape was extra certain to not mess up one single detail or forget one silly thing- after 8 years, of this plan didn’t work he didn’t know if another escape attempt would be possible.

Once out, he again, stealthed his way back into his house, just long enough to grab clothes and leave. Going nowhere near a mirror this time.

His new plan was to live out in the woods- live like the olden days. He built himself a little shelter and lived off nature.

It was difficult to acclimate to it, but once he did- he felt at peace with it. He found it to be a worthwhile life to live, and in some ways- ideal.

A few weeks passed and spring was beginning to transition to summer. The campers came out to appreciate that old fashioned life style. Leon had neighbors.

—

A couple of yuppies began to assemble their tent and bring stuff from their trucks to their site.

“This is going to be fun,” the girlfriend claimed.

“It will be if I can figure out this tent.” The boyfriend said.

“Don’t worry about it. We can just sleep under the stars. It will be romantic.”

“I don’t want to be bit by bugs, though.” The boyfriend countered.

“I didn’t think about bugs. Forget the stars and get that tent up”

He did and he helped her bring stuff from their vehicle, including a duffle bag.

“Geez honey, it’s only a couple nights- did you really need to bring all this stuff.”

“Survival is all in the preparation,” she laughed as she unzipped her duffle bag.

Leon was busy trying to widdle another stick into a spear as his last supply broke. The conversation of the yuppies distracted him and he nicked his thumb.

“Ouch!” He yelled.

“Did you hear that?” The yuppie girlfriend said, “I think we’ve got a neighbor! This will be fun!”

Leon heard the footsteps approaching his little shelter.

“Oh this is neat!” The girl said, “you could probably help my boyfriend with the tent! My names Jessica! Nice to meet you!”

“Leon,” Leon said passively, trying desperately to mind his own business.

“Oh my goodness! You’re hurt!” She said.

“It’s fine,” Leon winced trying to put pressure on the cut.

“We brought a first aid kit you should let us bandage you up.”

“It’s fine,” Leon repeated.

“I took a first aid class, and I can’t take no as an answer.” She said as she grabbed Leon’s arm and pulled him towards her camp site.

“What’s going on?” The boyfriend asked seeing her girlfriend dragging a man towards their site.

“He’s hurt, I’m going to bandage him up” she said, “it’s a good thing we were here.

It wouldn’t have happened if it weren’t for you, Leon thought.

She sat him down in a chair opposite her duffle bag. “Now where is that first aid kit?” She looked around in the various piles of belonging.

“Do I know you from some place?” The man asked.

“No,” Leon said.

“I think I do, whats your name?”

“Tom” Leon lied.

Just then a purple glow cake from the girlfriends duffle bag. Leon noticed it shortly after.

Leon began to get up. The girlfriend noticed this and pushed him back down, “now, now- no leaving until I patch you up.” Leon tried to get up again and then got pushed down again. “Baby, can you help me? I think the injury is starting to get to him.”

“Sure babe.” And the boyfriend held Leon down.

“No seriously, I’m fine” Leon pleaded, “this sorta thing happens all the time. I’ve dealt with it before.”

“If anything happens to you we’re legally liable.” The girlfriend replied.

“Whoa babe!” The boyfriend said, shocked, “what on earth did you PACK?!”

“What do you mean?”

“You’ve got a black light or something glowing in your duffle bag.”

A pair of stockings rose up from her duffle bag.

“What it going on?!” The boyfriend yelled, “and why did you bring stockings on a camping trip?”

“Whoa! Wait- I didn’t pack those”

While both of the yuppies were distracted, Leon took this as his opportunity to escape- slipping out from under the boyfriends grip and darting as far away from the duffle bag as he could get. The stockings immediately flew towards Leon faster than he could run and wrapped themselves around his wrists- to the bewilderment of the yuppies. They brought him back towards the yuppies’ campsite held just above the chair he was just sitting in.

“Please!” Leon yelled, “zip up the bag! Seal it shut!”

They weren’t paying attention to Leon instead just watching intently at the magic occurring before them.

“I can’t go back! Please! Zip it up!”

Black undergarments, a black evening gown and black heels soon lifted out of the duffle bag. The stockings dropped Leon, only to be caught by the undergarments as the stockings pulling his clothes off. The rest of the levitating outfit replaces the clothes once the old clothes were off, until Leon was dressed as Lea before the Yuppies.

“I KNEW she looked familiar!” The boyfriend said, “honey, that’s Princess Lea!”

“Pleasure to meet you!” The girlfriend said.

“You two are the worst,” Leon said in frustration right before he was flown into the duffle bag disappearing into the purple light within.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Escape attempt #3

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“My my my,” the Evil Queen said circling Leon, “after all this time...after all these years... you just can’t accept your fate, can you Lea?”

“That’s not my name, that’s not my fate,”

“And you’re still holding onto that whole ‘My name is Leon’ joke? Quite sad. Soon enough we’ll be crossing the point where you’ve spent more of your life as Lea than as Leon- will you accept that you’re Lea then?”

“No, because I’ve never BEEN Lea.”

The Evil Queen stared at Leon in silence and then paced away.

“I think your problem is a lack of gratitude, Lea” the Evil Queen continued, “Do you know how many other women would kill to be a princess? Do you realize what a gift it is for a common woman to be made into a noble woman?”

“I’m not a woman,” Leon said, uncertain as to why- he’s said it so many times over the years that the words have been rendered meaningless.

“You don’t understand. Your attachment to being a man is moot. You are a woman because that is the life that has been selected for you to live. A MAN as a princess? That’s absurd. Only a woman can be a princess, and you are a princess- therefore you are a princess.”

“I’m not a princess,” Leon rebuted.

“If you’re not a princess, then who’s face is that in that portrait?” The Evil Queen pointed to a large portrait of Leon immortalized as Lea on the canvas, “are you going to tell me that that’s not your face, that this isn’t your body? Tell you what- I’ll arrange for you to go home tomorrow morning if you can just do one thing. My army won’t come and collect you and bring you back here any more, if you just do this one thing.”

“Really?” Leon exclaimed hopefully, “what is it? I will do anything.”

“Your eagerness disappoints me. It’s unfortunate, really. I was hoping that you might replace me as Queen in a few years.”

“What do you want me to do to go back?”

“All you have to do is say ‘I am Lea’” the Evil Queen said, “Say it and you’ll be free to go back to where you deem home, don’t- and ill make absolutely certain you stay here for the rest of your life and then some. Maybe ensure you become a ghost to permanently inhabit one of your lovely outfits- do you have a preference?”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Release?

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“What’s your angle?” Leon asked.

“Why do you think I have an angle?” The Evil Queen asked.

“Why, after keeping me like this for all these years, would you release me for so small a request?”

“Given you aversion to the name, I’m surprised you deem it a small request?” The Evil Queen chuckled, “after all this time, I thought you would play ball- you didn’t. I thought you would eventually adapt to the new course of your life- you haven’t. I borderline give up. I just wanted to see if you were so stubborn to not at least consider calling yourself Lea even if just succumbing for a moment for your freedom.”

“That’s it?” Leon asked a bit skeptical, but deciding to take it at face value.

“That’s it. You win. I give up,” The Evil Queen answered.

“If that’s true, then why did you collect me that last time?”

“I have my pride- if you are to be free, it will be because I granted it- not because you stole it.” The Evil Queen said before shifting back to, “do we have a deal? Or are you going to keep dancing around it? Because, if you still want to dance I can grab your tutu.”

“I am Lea,” Lea said, “is that it?”

“Fine,” the Evil Queen said, “get some sleep. We’ll take you back home early tomorrow morning.”

Lea smiled, thinking that he was finally going to be free of being pulled between the mansion and the castle.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: “I am Lea”

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Despite the agreement for his imminent freedom, the clothes dressed him in the same regal feminine style he had been forced in all this time. Lea didn’t know why it continued, but took solace in it ending soon.

Dressed in a night gown he passed out as soon as his head hit the pillow. Once he was unconscious, the Evil Queen snuck into his room.

“I knew you wouldn’t be able to resist your freedom,” she said, “Now that you’ve referred to yourself as Lea, the first phase is complete. I don’t go back on my word, you’ll be free. I just need to do something to ensure you return.”

The Evil Queen held her gloves over the sleeping Lea and muttered a few magic words. A glowing purple smoke emitted from her palms and lowered down to Lea.

The sheets covering Lea shot off from the bed as Lea was lifted into the air. The purple smoke orbited and covered Lea before exploding and vanishing out of the room.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: As Lea sleeps

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“How’d you sleep, Lea?” The Evil Queen asked.

“Just because I agreed to your little bargain changes nothing. It’s not Leon, it’s Lea” he said not paying attention to what was actually said but instead groggy and focusing on what he had intended to say, “Now, I want to make sure that Tremaine isn’t going to try and grab me from the mirror and bring me back over to the mansion- that’s not going to happen, right?”

“Don’t worry, Lea,” the Evil Queen assured him, “when we first agreed to share you we set up a cutoff to where you would no longer be modeling for her and instead be focused on Royal matters. She agreed that you’d eventually have to be transitioned to Queen and that you’d be too old for modeling. She’s found a lovely lady to fulfill your modeling duties- at least until she develops a youth serum” the Evil Queen laughed.

“Good,” Lea responded suspiciously- though it seems highly unlikely that a youth serum could be developed- it’s certainly more likely than what he has undergone for the last decade.

“Are you sure you want to do this?” The Evil Queen asked, “after being royalty, do you really want to go back to being a mere commoner?”

“You and I both know it’s not the royalty im trying to escape from”

The Evil Queen sighed, “as you wish. I suppose I’ll just have to assign Katie as the heir to the throne.”

“Good”

“Oh! Is that a hint of jealousy I hear? It’s not too late.”

“Why would I be jeal-“ Lea began to exclaim, before calming himself down, “can we just go please?”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: The next morning

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Sending Lea home

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea cleaned up and stepped out of the Royal washroom when he was approached by a royal gown.

“Wait, wait- hold up! What is this? I’m not wearing this stuff anymore?” Lea yelled protecting himself from the dress equipping itself on him.

“Come now, Lea. Until you make it back home, you’re still the face of our empire. We can’t have the princess just moseying about in a meager blouse and skirt.”

“T shirt and jeans!” Lea scolded her.

“Hold your tongue,” the Evil Queen, disregarding Lea’s correction, “regardless of whatever agreement we’ve reached- it’s still the Queen you’re speaking to.”

“Fine” Lea acquiesced.

“Dress! Please clothe the princess until she gets home.

Lea winced as he was once again fully dressed as a woman trying to find peace that at least it would be the last time.

Lea was led to a mirror by the Evil Queen.

“Now dear, look how beautiful you look. Do you really want to abandon that?”

“I do,” Lea said, “please quit stalling”

“Very well,” the Evil Queen scoffed in frustration, “before you go, I want to offer you a parting gift.” Before Lea’s eyes, a formal evening clutch purse flew over to the Evil Queens grasp. “This purse and it’s contents will remain on your premises or person- if you see fit at all times. You will not be able to get rid of it. It contains cosmetics and other accessories, but the most important thing is this.” She said pulling out a compact mirror, “this is your line of communication with me- should you change your mind.”

“I won’t”

“You say that, but it will be there if you need it- no matter what you do to rid yourself of it.”

“I don’t want it”

Right after he said those words the bag flew out of the Evil Queens gloves and right towards Lea. He tried to dodge it only to find it hanging gracefully on his arm.

The Evil Queen directed his attention back to the mirror where his newly equipped accessory really finished the picture, he looked completely made up and ready for some formal ball. He winced for, what he hoped would be, his last time.

The Evil Queen then led him to the wardrobe and opened the doors.

“Well, off you go!”

“Through the tunnel?”

“Naturally!” The Evil Queen said, “it’s the quickest and least conspicuous means of transporting you out of here.”

“I thought you said you can only use that to travel between women’s wardrobes...”

“That’s right!” The Evil Queen replied, “Lets say...we made an exception. Yes...let’s say that.”

“I’ve got qualms about traveling through that- it’s always been a terrible and embarrassing experience every time I’ve gone through that thing.”

“I thought you wanted to get home as soon as possible. We can certainly send you home through a jet if you’re really attached to wearing that outfit for a few more hours?”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Through the tunnel

choices: Lea goes to replenish his wardrobe
Lea tried to get a date
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea is thrown out from the entrance to his closet and lands face first onto the floor.

“Man, for believing I’m a princess they sure did treat me like a rag doll.” Lea said to himself.

After saying that he made a mental rule to never say or think the word “Princess” as that last statement sent a chill up his spine.

He sat up from the floor and laughed in massive relief and victory.

“It’s over!” He exclaimed, “it’s finally over.”

He ran over to the mirror, and looked at it cautiously half expecting Tremaine dresses to jump through. When they didn’t, he laughed and celebrated further.

“It feels so good to be Lea again!” He exclaimed in celebration and then paused. Did he say what he thought he said?

He ran back to the mirror to test it, “my name is Lea” he said, “No! My name is LEA!” Each time he tried to say Leon it came out as Lea.

“NO! Not LEON! LEA!”

Just a weird mix match, he supposed. So he tried to reverse it by saying “not Leon. Lea” and it came out “not Leon. Lea”

It appeared that no matter what he tried, he couldn’t help but refer to himself as Lea.

Enraged, he remembered that thing about the compact mirror and he ran to the clutch that he was forced to take with him, pulled the mirror out of it, and opened it.

“Evil Queen!” He yelled into it.

“Lea! Calling to request to return to your role as Princess?”

“No!” Lea yelled, “Why do I keep referring to myself as Lea?!”

“Because that’s who you are!”

“No I’m not! I’m LEA”

“You’re sending mixed messages, Lea”

Lea grunted, “what did you do?”

“I didn’t do anything,” she said coyly, “you said it yourself I am Lea’”

“Because you wanted me to!”

“I’ve been wanting you to for a while, but I guess it only happened when your most inner self was ready to accept it. You said it, and I guess it agreed, Lea.”

“Fine, it doesn’t matter. I’ll just use my middle name: Ellen” he said in an attempt to say “Alan”

“Ellen!” He tried again, “what are you up to?!”

“What am I up to? You’re the one saying these things!” The Evil Queen laughed.

“Whatever- it doesn’t matter. A name is just a name. It doesn’t determine my life. I’ll make do despite your cruel tricks.” He said and then slammed the mirror shut.

Frustratedly, he ripped the dress off of his body, threw it on the floor and walked into his closet.

Before that dreaded mansion, he had always had a minimal wardrobe- he has never been one for excess. However, in his current predicament that seemed to work against him.

After his previous escape attempt he would take clothes from his closet, get abducted back to either location and his captors would handle and dispose of the clothes as though they were contaminated. He was now looking at one last outfit- and a bad one at that. He grabbed the outfit and returned to his bedroom to put it on.

As he was putting on the last remnants of his clothes he saw the fancy gown beginning to rustle on the ground. He watched it intently with grave suspicion.

It lifted itself up into the air. Lea grabbed a bat leaning against the wall to defend himself from what had happened so many times before.

To his relief the gown backed away from him. To his fears it backed itself into the closet. He followed the floating gown with his bat in hand into the closet where he watched the dress hang itself up right in the middle of the closet.

Lea poked it with his bat.

“Hey,” poke, “what do you think you’re doing?!” Poke.

He then got angry and tore the gown off of its hanger and threw it out of the closet and onto the floor of his bedroom again.

The gown, once again, lifted itself from the floor and hung itself up in his closet.

Lea violently reopened the compact mirror, “Evil Queen!”

“Calling to request to return to your role as Princess?”

“No!” Lea yelled, “are you going to ask me that every time?! Stop asking me that! I will never return!”

“Sure.” She replied coyly,”just as well though- because we don’t even WANT you here. We’re thinking Katie might actually make a better princess and, someday, a better Queen. Honestly, we don’t know why we spent so much time trying to mold you into that role, when she’s such a natural fit.”

“Good!” Lea exclaimed in infinite frustration.

“Oh Lea! You’re too good! You called my bluff! I was just trying to make you jealous”

“That’s. Not. Going. To. Make. Me. Jealous.” Lea yelled, “I just want to be Lea. Shoot! Lea! No!” He wrestled his name again, the frustration causing him to forget, “I don’t want to be princess. I never wanted to be princess. I WILL never want to be princess”

He winced again after having broken his “princess” ban three times.

“This is where I call YOUR bluff,” the Evil Queen said, “you’ve been home for ten minutes and you’ve already called me twice. Just come clean and accept that you want to return to fulfill your destiny as princess and, someday, as Queen!”

“I WILL NOT COME CLEAN!” Lea knee-jerked yelled in frustration before realizing what that implied, “I mean...I will never want to come back- it’s not my destiny. My destiny is to be a man! At home! Not some princess!”

Rats! He has said that word again. Now that he was home it creeped him out more with each repeated use.

“If you don’t want to come back to return to your destined role as princess then why are you calling?”

“Why does this damn gown keep hanging itself up in my closet?”

“Oh! Did I forget to mention that?” The Evil Queen asked, “that’s another one of those gifts that’s staying with you- that you can’t get rid of(no matter what). In fact, that’s the most important gift.”

“Why?”

“That’s your way back. You put that gown on and it will render your separation null and void and return you here to fulfill your duties for the rest of time.”

“No, I don’t want it. Take it back”

“We’ll take it back when you bring it.”

“I don’t want to come back!” Lea screamed.

“Then just don’t wear the dress!”

Lea in a fit of rage slammed the mirror shut and tossed it out the window. Followed by the purse. He then yanked the dress out of the closet bundled it in a crude ball and bunched it under his arm, where he marched it outside and slammed it into the dumpster. He then grabbed a large decorative rock and placed it atop the lid of the dumpster to keep the lid closed, and marched back inside.

He returned to his bedroom and collapsed onto his bed.

After a moment a large crash emitted from his room as a large rock crashes through his window, he looked up to see the smashed in window and shortly after seeing the gown effortlessly float in through his window and again find its home in his closet. This was followed by the purse floating through the window and placing itself on his arm as the opened mirror floated over to his hand where the Evil Queen was waiting for him.

“Have we learned not to do that?” The Evil Queen asked.

Lea slammed the mirror shut and threw it aside. Recognized the purse hanging off his arm, he ripped it off and tossed it by the mirror.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Lea makes it home

Lea didn’t notice them and they made their way inside
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea made it to the mall and head for the men’s clothing stores he remembered from back when he was Leon. In all those years, all those stores seemed to have been closed or replaced.

It appears there was now one store that catered to both men and women.

—

“Excuse me,” Lea asked a store clerk, “where’s your men’s department?”

“It’s in the middle of the store,” the clerk said, “ you cant miss it. Everything else is for women.”

“Thanks,” Lea said.

“Women’s unmentionables are to the right,” the clerk continued, “formal wear at the back. Casual wear to the left.”

“Why are you telling me this?” Lea asked.

“I don’t know,” the clerk answered stunned by confusion, “I guess I must be tired...?”

“I hope you feel better,” Lea concluded before turning away.

“Oh! Sir! I think you dropped your... mirror?”

Lea turned around and saw the familiar, feminine mirror in the clerks hand and became stunned, he muttered, “oh...umm....that’s not mine...”

“Sir, I just saw it fall out of your pocket...”

“Oh...well, you can keep it. I don’t want it.”

“Sir, that’s against store policy.” The clerk uttered in offense before shoving the mirror in Lea’s hand.

As Lea walked away and began to shove the mirror in his pocket, the lid of the mirror flipped open by its self. Lea inspected it.

The Evil Queen scolded him “you can keep it,”

“What are you doing here?!” Lea yelled into the compact mirror, while trying not to draw attention.

The Evil Queen dismissed his question, “you try that again, and I’ll be sure to materialize the purse with you.”

Lea repeated his question, “what are you doing here?! Why are you following me or doing whatever you’re doing?”

“It is the Queens duty to ensure the safety of her replacement.”

“I’m not going to be your replacement!” Lea whispered sternly.

While Lea was busy with arguing with his make-up mirror, a woman walked past him pushing a cart of clothes she had collected for herself before going to shop for her husband in the very men’s section that Lea was currently perusing.

An inert pair of panties sense the aura of Lea’s presence and “woke up” as a result of the spell the Evil Queen placed on Lea in the last night in her kingdom. Th year draped themselves over the kart while the woman was looking as a stack of trousers and Lea was busy arguing with the Evil Queen. The woman threw a pair of men’s pants in the cart and the cart swayed and knocked up against Lea’s leg. Lea didn’t notice the cart that bumped into him, let alone the pair of panties that seemed stuck to his pant leg with, what would seem to be static electricity.

“Leave me alone!” Lea eventually told the Queen, “stick by your agreement and let me live my life!” Hanging up the mirror. And sticking it in his pocket.

Lea was so pleased to be shopping for clothes he didn’t notice the pair of panties, appearing to be innocently stuck to his leg, was rather un-innocently crawling up his pant leg. Lea looked at jeans, the panties crawled up, and shirts, the panties crawled up, socks and underwear, the panties had reached the hips of his pants and began to tuck themselves into the rim of his pants and continue to work on inserting themselves inside.

They made it halfway inside when...
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Lea goes to replenish his wardrobe

Leon buys his clothes and returns home
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“What’s this?” Lea asked herself noticing the panties stuck to his leg. He pulled them off, feeling the static rip from his pants.

He felt a chill up his spine, but didn’t suspect anything of the situation. With the panties in his hand he looked around and found the woman and her cart nearby.

“Excuse me, miss?” He got her attention, “I think these are yours?”

“Oh! Why yes! Thank you! These were the only pair left in my size!”

She reached over to grab the panties and then felt her self get pulled towards Lea. Her torso pressed into his pushing his hands with the panties into his body. Her sleeves wrapped around his body. To Lea it just appeared to be an ordinary, though unexpected hug. Neither Lea nor the woman was aware of how or how the hem of her dress wrapped itself around Lea’s shins.

“Oh wow!” Lea exclaimed shocked, “It’s no big deal! Really.”

From the inside of his grip, the panties slid themselves out from his uncertain grip and slid themselves down his body and burrowed into his left pants pocket.

The woman eventually stepped away from Lea. “I’m sorry! I don’t know what came over me. I guess it’s been a while since I’ve talked to a man as handsome as you. Don’t tell my husband!” She laughed.

“Your secret is safe with me,” she smiled.

After the awkward situation, they both walked away not noticing how the panties disappeared.

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea always hated trying clothes on when he went shopping, but given how much his life had changed in all this time, and how loosely fitting his current outfit was- he no longer knew what size he was. After he found a few outfits with variable sizes he decided he should go through with the hassle of trying the clothes on and discover what his new size is.

He began pushing his cart towards the changing rooms over to the left of the store, past the women’s casual wear.

The panties, now safe from detection from the obstruction of the cart, casually climbed out from Lea’s pants pocket and began making its way up to and inside the waistband of his pants.

As he made his way through the casual wear, he came across a woman heading in the opposite direction. He pushed his cart over to the right so that the woman could pass him. As he did this, a couple of skirts fell off from their hangers and burrowed themselves into the middle of his stack of clothes. Distracted by the attractive woman passing and smiling at him, he didn’t notice that a couple of the blouses she had hanging over the side of her cart lifted themselves to hang over into the inside of his cart as she passed and then fell into his cart- also burrowing into his stack of clothes.

What followed next on his trek toward the fitting rooms could most closely be described as “consumption”. The blouses and skirts inside his cart began to eat away at the clothes he collected, just as the panties now inside his pants began to eat away at the boxers he was wearing while simultaneously replacing them around his waist. Lea was too distracted by his hesitation to try on clothes to notice the tightening sensation of his undergarments, not to mention it was hardly an alien sensation at this point.

From here...
