1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
There is only one changing room large enough for Lea to bring his cart into, and it appears that the last person to use it didn’t clear out all their stuff as there were still: a pair of heels, an opened container of pantyhose, and a bra left hanging on the hanger.

Lea didn’t think anything of it as he grabbed the pair of pants lying at the top of his cart- not noticing how his stack had shrieked since he made it here, not noticing the skirts and blouses that were lying immediately underneath the pants he just grabbed.

As soon as he looked back at the mirror, he saw the clutch purse materialized on the shelf next to the hanger.

“Oh come on!” Lea complained, “I hope she’s not expecting me to tote this thing around the mall.” He grabbed it in frustration to find the bra get snagged on his sleeve. He pulled his arm away and the bra fell off the hanger and remain stuck to his shirt sleeve.

“What is this?!” He yelled in amused annoyance void of worry despite the warning signs of the panties from earlier. He tugged at the bra hanging from his sleeve, but it appeared that the hooks appeared to be caught on a few stray threads of his shirt. Given how little clothes he had left, he didn’t want to risk tearing up his current shirt, so he put the bra caught on his shirt on the back burner that he would address once he tried on one of the shirts he falsely believed were in his cart. He didn’t notice that the bra was slowly snaking it’s way further up his sleeve.

He sighed and began to undo his pants trying best to ignore the ridiculous bra swinging around him as he did so. He unbuttoned and the unzipped, and went through the motions of replacing his old pants with the new ones- until he dropped trow and noticed the underwear he was currently wearing.

“What the-?!” He yelled, startled. Immediately recognizing them as the panties from earlier, “but how?! When?!”

He then noticed the ridiculous hanging from his sleeve was less flagrant as, now, it was only a the straps hanging out from his sleeve.

It only took a split second for him to shoot through the confusion and see what was happening, but that appeared to be a split second too long- as he shot his hang to grab the straps only for them to quickly disappear up his sleeve. He tried to reach in and still pull them back out, but it appeared that once they were hidden they were no longer under any obligation to move stealthily- as the bra quickly scampered up his arm, wrapped itself around his torso and somehow put itself around his other arm and clipped itself around his back. He stared at the mirror in an ominous disbelief as the chest of his shirt stuck out proudly and his ass was lifted up.

“This can’t be happening,” he muttered to himself as he began to unbutton his shirt in hopes of rectifying the situation. He glanced down into his cart, plotting his next move and seeing only the blouses and skirts that he didn’t put in there. “What is going on?! Why is this happening?!”

“No!” He muttered, hoping it had all been a bad dream, “no-no-no-no-no!”

“No no no” he continued to yell in futility. He searched around the fitting room looking for his own clothes that he came in with- finding nothing but the spare blouse and skirt. “Come on!” He yelled.

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea reached into his purse, pulled out the compact mirror and flipped it open.

“Lea! Are you ready to return to your life as a princess?” The Evil Queen asked.

“WHAT DID YOU DO?!” Lea asked.

“You look wonderful, Lea! Not that of royalty- but still very nice! I can definitely see why Tremaine would want you as a model! It’s lucky that she can’t see you now, otherwise she might want to track you down again.”

“WHAT DID YOU DO?!” Lea repeated with an unrelenting aggressiveness.

“You got me,” the Evil Queen replied, “there’s a small chance than when you said ‘I am Lea’ that I might have used that as your consenting to your new life- and after having said that i might have cast a spell that awakened the innate desire that clothing such as what you’re wearing now have to be worn by you. You might not think clothing has any awareness, but after your long modeling career- I assure you that the clothes are VERY aware of you.”

“This is not what I agreed to!” Lea yelled.

“Nor is it not what you didn’t agree to,” the Evil Queen replied.

“What?”

“I agreed to allow you to return home. Which is where you are. I agreed to not steel you back here, which- do you notice how the clothes are not pulling you back into the stock room to bring you back to the kingdom? Because they’re not. Just because you’re temporarily not princess doesn’t mean you shouldn’t look your best.”

“Not temporary. Permanent. I’m not returning.”

“Oh right. Of course. I’m sure all your old chums would love to see your new look.”

Lea didn’t think of that. It was one thing to be parading around the mansion and the castle like this where no one knew who he was- it was another to be forced into these situations around places where people knew him. Worse still now that he could only refer to himself as “Lea” or “Ellen”. These damn entities were doing everything in their power to overwrite his identity as this Lea girl...

“Was this your play from the start? Send me back just to destroy my old life just so I would succumb to being your princess.”

“You make me sound so...EVIL. I’m just trying to open your eyes to your DESTINY, Lea.”

“That’s not my destiny. I refuse to allow it to be my destiny. I’m aware of your tricks now, it will be easier to avoid it. And even if not, I’d sooner return to Tremaine than to give you what you want by becoming your princess.”

“Is that so?” The Evil Queen asked.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Calling the Evil Queen

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Lea gets clothes and returns home

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea threw the spare blouse and skirt out onto the floor and pushed his now empty cart sneakily out of the dressing room. He didn’t want anyone to draw a comparison from how he went in and how he came out.

He turned the corner and didn’t see anyone around. He then, more calmly tried to assume the role he was forced into. He’d been doing it for a decade- so it wasn’t difficult or even risky, just not ideal.

He then returned to the center of the store and threw various handfuls of men’s clothing into his cart. He went with his old size. It didn’t matter if it was too big for him now- it was nothing a belt couldn’t fix anyway. It might look a bit off wearing such loose fitting clothing, but it would at least look like him.

Once he had collected a good stock pile of clothes he could wear, he headed to the checkout counter.

The lady behind the counter scanned all the clothes and told Lea, “your boyfriends a lucky man”

Lea swallowed his nausea and just smiled and nodded.

“Your total today is $183.64”

Lea reached for his back pocket to grab his wallet, but all he could find was the smooth material of his skirt. His wallet- it was in his pants. But where was his pants. He checked the purse to see if it relocated in there after his pants were magic’d away. No wallet. No money. Not one dime.

“You’ve got to be kidding me,” Lea moaned.

“Uh oh! No money”

“Please-“ Lea begged too desperate to think of a believable story, “you’ve got to help me. I had money when I came in here, but these bizarre clothes took my wallet and all my money.”

The checkout lady looked at Lea as though he had just escaped from the psyche ward.

“I know it doesn’t make sense. But I’m telling you that’s what happened. Clothes came to life and took all my money. I shouldn’t even be dressed like this!”

The checkout lady replied, “may...be... he’s not a lucky guy. I’m sorry, I don’t know what’s going on, but I can’t help you.”

“Please! Don’t leave me like this. Look, I promise you- you let me take these clothes and I- no- my ‘boyfriend’ will come back and pay you. I swear it.”

“I’m sorry Miss, but if you don’t have money I’m going to have to ask you to leave the store. Or else I will have to call security”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: No

choices: A man offers to take him home
He sees someone he knows and they give him a ride
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea walks out of the store and looks desperately out towards the parking lot. He needed to get back home. But what for? More cash to try to get some more clothes? How was he going to get home?

What was he going to do? If what the Evil Queen said was true, then wearing men’s clothing was only a temporary solution- it appeared that every feminine article had a hit out on him. How long would a new wardrobe last?

“Think Lea, think” he whispered to himself- a bit put off by the recollection that he can only refer to himself by that woman’s name. “What am I going to do?”

He thought maybe he could return to nature like he did the last time he escaped- but envisioned himself waking up redressed in a grass skirt and leafy top.

“One step at a time.” He thought, “first- get home. Second, get more clothes.”

He watched the women walking into the store and watched as their purses and loose clothing began to waver in his direction as though there were a breeze blowing in his direction- but the air was still.

“One step at a time,” he repeated to himself.

How was he going to get home?
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Lea goes willingly

choices: “I guess- if it’s not too much trouble”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea stands there still thinking about what he’s going to do when he sees his best friend from his Leon days approaching the building.

“Oh no!” Lea thinks to himself, “I can’t let Blake see me like this!”

He quietly runs as fast as his heels would take him without falling over- that would be just what he needed- he quickly turns a corner and accidentally bumps into someone.

“Whoa!” The man yells.

“Oh no! I’m sorry” Lea pleads as quietly as possible.

“Well, hello!” The man says after looking Lea up and down.

“Are you alright?” Lea asks.

“I am now. What’s your name?”

“Umm...Lea...”

“Nice to meet you, Lea. I’m Matt”

“Hi...” Lea says, he had never been flirted with before- he didn’t think things could reach a new low, but apparently with his reintroduction to society, his current predicament presented new conflicts he hadn’t accounted for.

“So where were you off to in such a hurry?”

“Oh...I was just trying to...” he began pointing back considering saying he was trying to avoid Blake, but decided against it, “find a ride back home...” he reluctantly said, “it appears that my friends left me stranded here and I don’t have any money to get back.”

Lea hated fishing for a ride like this, but he has no other option.

“Would you like me to give you a ride back home? I was just leaving myself”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: A man offers to take him home

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“Yeah, as long as it’s not too much trouble” Lea said, feeling a mixture of salvation and damnation.

“Helping a beautiful woman like yourself is never to much trouble,” he winked. Lea feigned a smile while combatting a heavy nausea.

Matt wrapped his arm around Lea’s waist and directed him to his car. Once there, he opened the door for Lea and assisted him in getting in- the flow of the movement left little for second thoughts.

Soon after Matt got in and they drove off.

—-

“So, what brought you to the mall today?” Matt asked.

Lea figured he could at least answer this honestly, “Oh, I had just gotten back home from out of town, only to discover all of my clothes missing. I went to the mall to get some more clothes, only to discover my wallet missing.”

“Ouch,” Matt said.

“Yeah- not a fun day.” Lea groaned.

“You know,” Matt began, “if you’d, I don’t know, want to hang out again. I’d be happy to take you clothes shopping.”

“Oh- I don’t know...” Lea countered.

“Oh no! It’s fine! I used to take my last girlfriend clothes shopping all the time. It’s no problem- I’ve got a good job.”

Girlfriend. This was concerning.

“Still...I’m not sure...”

“Tell you what,” Matt said, “just take down my number, think about it, and if you want to- just give me a call.”

“I don’t even think I have my phone on me,” Lea said just as the purse in his lap emitted a small chime. He opened it and pulled out his cell phone. Great.

There was a text from someone saved as “E.Q.” that read “he’s cute”

“Just let me know when you’re ready,” Matt said.

“Oh I don’t think-“

“I hate to do this,” Matt said, “but I took you all the way home, gave you fun conversation, the least you can do is take down my phone number. You don’t have to CALL me unless you want to. Just take it down.”

“Okay.” Lea relented, “what’s your number?”

Matt gave Lea his number.

“Now save it” Matt said.

Just as Lea was going to push “Save contact” the phone started dialing the number without Lea pushing anything.

“What?!” Lea fearfully thought to himself.

Matt’s phone started ringing, he glanced at it, “Well, that works too!”

Lea nervously laughed.

—
Matt pulled up to Lea’s house.

“Well, I guess I’ll call you sometime. We’ll do that clothes shopping.”

“Yeah...whatever...” Lea said trying to sound dismissive while stepping out of the car.

“Wait a minute!” Matt yelled after Lea got out of the car, “you don’t have ANY other clothes, do you?”

“No,” Lea accidentally answered honestly.

“I hate to be forward, but how about we hang out tomorrow and get you some new clothes?”

“We’ll see” Lea said as dismissively as possible.

“Great! It’s a date!” Matt said winking before driving off.

Lea walked towards his house and found the opened contact mirror in his hand.

“That Matt seems like a real Prince,” the Evil Queen said.

“What do you mean...?”

“Oh....nothing...”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: “I guess- if it’s not too much trouble”

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Once inside, Lea once again ripped off his feminine clothes and let them fall to the floor like deja vu. Just like before the clothes reanimated themselves and hung them selves up in Lea’s closet.

Lea has half a mind to call the Evil Queen to find out why these new clothes kept placing themselves in his closet it, but didn’t feel like hearing her try to convince him to return as a princess or to say something like “that’s how we were able to transport you back to your closet because it’s going to be a women’s wardrobe going forward.” Taking to the Evil Queen has never been fruitful, so no matter how upset he was- he figures he was just going to handle things on his own.

—

If there was one thing that really rubbed off on him when he was “a princess” it was the daily bath. Given the amount of stress and frustration each day gave him, the bath did provide a necessary peace of mind. The events of today were no exception.

He laid in the tub celebrating the escape of that mall and that outfit while pondering the pieces at play:
- women’s clothing was still going to try to put themselves on him
- it appears that he’s going to have to avoid that AND this Matt guy
- The Evil Queen seems to be encouraging relations between “Lea” and Matt
- She called him a “Prince” which can only be an ominous foreshadowing

“Perhaps I SHOULD just put on that gown and go back to being a princess before things get any worse...” Lea said before shaking his head and responding with “what the hell am I thinking?! I will not go willingly into that hell!”

Lea finished his bath, dried off, put on a pair of boxers and slipped under the covers of his bed- satisfied that at least he was going to bed dressed as a man.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: That night

choices: Making sure that doesn’t happen again
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea found himself on stage, in his familiar tutu performing a dance for an unseeable audience. All those years of practice were finally paying off as he excite each step and movement of the performance with perfect grace. He was performing so well, he could have sworn that he heard the Evil Queen praising him with each landing. Perfect. Excellent. Beautiful ballerina girl. He didn’t even raise any qualms with that last one. He was doing so well, he ended up echoing it “I AM a beautiful ballerina girl”

what am I thinking?

The piece ended and there was a roar of applause and he bowed and embraced the warm response to his dance.

Next thing he knew he was stepping back stage to change into his suit. He removed the tutu in one downward pull. It has never been this easy to remove it before

“Always a pleasure to change out of that tutu” he thought, excited to get back into a regular suit for the after party and to soak up all the praise.

He slipped on his boxers, acknowledging that they felt a little tight on him and then pulled on the suit, feeling a bit perplexed that it was all just one piece. I’ve never seen a suit like this

He stepped into the suit and pulled it up over his legs, hips, torso and letting it rest on his shoulders before reaching back to the zipper to secure the suit on him. As he reached for the zipper he noticed the black of the suit was not so much black as it was purple- and there appeared to be little sparkles on it. Also, his legs could feel the texture of the other leg.

did I accidentally stick both my feet into the same leg hole?

Something wasn’t right. What was going on here? He began to zip up from the back.

Wait a minute. He stopped zipping.

Wait a minute.

This isn’t a suit. It can’t be.

Lea woke up to find himself, not in his bed, but in his closet draped in the gown and his hands on the zipper.

“Whoa! What the hell?! What the hell is going on?!”

He threw the dress off him, which promptly returned itself to its hanger. He took off the gowns matching panties and put back on the boxers he has stripped himself out of.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: A dream

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea woke up the following morning, completely covered by the sheets over his head. No matter how much he tried pulling the sheets down from his torso his head would not be unveiled from under the covers.

He shot up to find he was still covered. He began ripping at the material covering his face to discover it was a bunch of feminine under-attire held to him. He also discovered a conga line of unmentionables leading from the broken window to his dresser. Then he discovered that in his sleep he had been redressed in a nightgown.

He stormed to his dresser to interrupt the train of clothes from their destination- though a bit too late as it appeared that all of his boxers had been replaced.

“Dammit!” Lea yelled. He then ran to the open window to see where this was coming from. It appeared that one of his neighbors was up early and doing the laundry with their window open and their newly washed clothes was floating out of their window and into his.

He began to think he might have underestimated this curse that the Evil Queen put on him. It appeared that yesterday, at the mall, it was at its weakest and it seemed to be getting stronger- either with time or the more interaction he had with women’s clothes.

He ran to his closet and looked at the gown with a sense of dread and sorrow. Perhaps he should cut his losses before anything got too out of hand?
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Waking up in the morning

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Just then, Lea’s phone began to ring. He ran over to see who it was: Matt

“Nope,” Lea said, “That’s the last thing I want to deal with right now”

Just then, the stockings from yesterday wrapped themselves around his feet and he fell to the floor as a bra tangled itself around his hands. The phone fell next to his head and somehow picked up the call.

“Lea?” Matt asked.

“Hey Matt...” Lea asked wrestling against the confines of the tangled clothing at his limbs.

“I’m glad you’re up! I had a lot of fun talking with you yesterday and I was wondering if you wanted to go clothes shopping like we discussed?”

“Ummm,” Lea said trying to think of a way out. He was sure he had more money hidden somewhere in his house- he could easily just take a cab to an exclusively male clothing store, burn this house down and then live in vacant lot miles away from others.

“Now, now” Matt continued, “I’m not going to take no for an answer- you need clothes and I want to help you. There doesn’t have to be any strings attached, I just want to help you.”

“Oh...ummm,” Lea was decidedly bad at thinking on his feet when he was pulled off his feet.

“Great! I’ll see you in thirty minutes!” And then Matt hung up, and the bindings on his arms and ankles became loose again.

“What in the hell are you all up to?!” Lea yelled at all the clothes he has spent so long trying to escape from.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: The phone rings

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
It was almost right out of a slapstick comedy when Matt arrived, and Lea was bombarded from the outfit from yesterday.

He was overwhelmed by the swarm. Every swipe and struggle he did to fight them off only served to assist them in placing themselves on him. While the cosmetics from his purse worked on his face. “Stop this! I don’t want to go!”

Once the outfit was one the stockings and heels made their move, he lost his balance, fell out the front door and tripped backwards down the steps before finally losing his fight with gravity and finally falling backwards. Where he expected to collide with the pavement he found himself in the passenger seat of Matt’s car with his head on his lap.

“Whoa nelly! No need to rush on my account!” Matt said.

Lea thought about how he wouldn’t have gotten in the car willingly and yet still found himself in it. Unable to think of anything else to respond with he merely emitted a nervous laugh.

“While I love your head in my lap, we really must get going” Matt said, “perhaps we can revisit this later”

Lea shot up nervously and Matt drove off causing the passenger side door to close.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Matt arrives

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
From inside the clothing store, Lea could see the men’s department from every section of the store, and while he tried to steer him and Matts trajectory towards the center of the store, he could never fully get there.

“If only I had a chance to grab the cash before coming here I could have ditched Matt, gotten my own clothes, and taken a cab back home” Lea scolded himself.

Instead he was stuck with Matt going up and down every aisle when the occasional article of clothing would jump from the rack into his hand, always with Matt saying “excellent taste! Put it in the cart! I love a girl with a sense of style.”

“Me too,” Lea wanted to say- as he reflected on how long he’s been pre-occupied with this never ending struggle. He longed for the days when the biggest thing he had to worry about was getting a girl to go on a date with him.

-

The shopping trip continued as the clothes continued to inform him of what he would eventually be wearing by continuing to jump out at him.

Lea grunted every time- seeing his damnable wardrobe continuing to grow.

Eventually Matt steered the cart back to the back of the store where the formal attire was.

“Wait,” Lea asked, “what are we doing back here?”

“I didn’t plan this out properly- I was wanting to surprise you.” Matt said, “I felt that we had such a connection that I went ahead and made a reservation for 2 at Le Fanci Restaurante tonight and they have a strict dress code”

“Oh Matt,” Lea muttered nervously, “No...I don’t...”

“No, no!” Matt cut Lea off, “don’t feel guilty! I want to do it. You’re worth it. Listen, I’m going to leave you alone here to pick out which gown you want to wear tonight. After you pick one out, we’ll spend the day together, and then we’ll get dinner at Le Fanci and we’ll see where the night takes us”

“See where the night takes us?!” Lea was haunted by those words.

“Im going to make a quick phone call, I’ll be right back.”

“No. Matt. Wait!” Lea tried to cancel Matt’s plans.

“Don’t worry, babe!” He said continuing to walk away, “I’ll come back for you!”

Once Matt was out of sight, Lea tried to run. He would hitchhike back home if need be. Or to avoid any further scenarios, he would walk- 15 miles isn’t that far when you really think about it.

As soon as Lea tried to make a run for it he found himself held back by something. He turned to see what was holding him to see a black, a red, and a blue evening gown all holding him.

The next ten minutes consisted of a three way tug of war battle with Lea as the rope.

When Matt eventually returned he found Lea holding:
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: To the mall

choices: Stop by Lea’s home to drop off the clothes
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea, once again, found himself in the position of a rag doll as the three dresses were pulling him to and fro between themselves. He couldn’t get past it: while he presumed that, for these feminine items, it was supposed to be an honor or something- it would stand to reason that they would, perhaps, treat him honorably.

They didn’t. The closest thing to it they gave him was resetting his hair when it fell out of place in their wrestling over him. Which he wasn’t sure if they were trying to be kind or insulting.

The struggle was bad enough when they were exclusively pulling at his sides trying to claim their prize, but- in a series of events that Lea couldn’t put his finger on, the fight found its way to second gear when he found himself horizontal in the air while the red dress was tugging at his arms, the blue dress tugging at his left leg, the black dress at his right.

If Lea wasn’t already upset at wearing a skirt, he would certainly be now as the dresses parted his legs revealing “the goods” from the opening of his skirt to anyone that might have walked by, and the captivity of his arms eliminated anything he could have done to save himself the smallest amount of decency.

“What are you doing?!” Lea yelled, “stop it! Stop it right now!”

If the overwhelming embarrassment of his current predicament, the uncomfortable stretching of his parted legs further upped the ante. Lea took a brief moment to mentally escape his situation by finding a gratitude that he was forced to learn ballet every day for so many years- otherwise his agony would have been exponentially worse.

He returned to the matter at hand, looking down to see the parting of his legs, causing his skirt to ride up, now leading to the panties he was forced into to be exposed to the light.

“Oh please!” Lea yelled still being tugged in three different directions, “this is too much! Just make it stop!”

“Lea!” Matt yelled from around the corner, “did you find a dress for tonight?” Lea shot a frightened look down to the opening of the aisle.

In a split second, the black and blue dress flew back onto their hangers causing Lea to immediately slam onto the floor below. Not having much time, he quickly hopped to his heeled feet, pulled his skirt back down to his lower thighs and straightened the struggle out of his clothes. The dress shot up from the floor to his hand just as Matt turned the corner.

“Red.” Matt said with excitement,”Spicy. The color of passion“

Matt smiled at Lea with a glance that made the coldest chill climb up his spine.

Lea hated to succumb to it, but he decided that he had to get back to that Royal gown as soon as possible.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: The red gown

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“Alright! I was thinking we could hit up the park next” Matt began, “I know this hidden little slot that is very romantic. You’re going to love it.”

“Sounds...great...” Lea tried to force out, “though, do you suppose we could stop by my house to unload my new clothes” it killed him to refer to those things as his, but if he was going to get out of this situation he was going to have to give a presentation that would sell.

“You’re not just hoping to use me for clothes and then split are you?” Matt jokingly asked.

“Oh no!” Lea gave a hesitant laugh, “it’s just that, I don’t know if you’ve noticed this- but I’ve been wearing the same thing for the past two days and it’s killing me”

“I think you look beautiful,” Matt assured him.

“It’s a girl thing. You wouldn’t understand,” Lea was still wincing deep down with the performance he had to give.

“Alright...alright...” Matt have in, “quick pit stop back at your place for you to get changed- but don’t think that you’re going to get out of our special day together.”

“I wouldn’t dream of such a thing,” Lea said while dreaming of such a thing.

—-

Matt pulled up to Lea’s house and Lea immediately made a dash for his front door.

“Aren’t you going to take some of your clothes?” Matt asked.

Lea forced himself to give out a little giggle, “I guess I was so excited to get changed that I forgot the clothes.”

Lea grabbed a couple of bags from the trunk and made his way inside. He walked to his bedroom and began to make his way to the closet when he heard, “is anywhere fine?”

Lea jumped, “oh! I didn’t hear you following me. Yeah, wherever is good.”

“What happened to your window?” Matt asked whine setting down the six full bags he had brought in.

“It’s a long story...”

“If you want I can try to get that fixed for you”

“It’ll be fine,” Lea said, not expecting to be around for much longer.

“No it won’t. I don’t like the idea of you staying somewhere so unprotected. You don’t know who’s out there that can just come in through your window.”

“Right,” Lea acknowledged, glancing over at his dresser.

“Then it’s settled, I’ll try to get that taken care of for you.” Matt said, “but anyway, now that everything’s been brought in, I’m going to give you some privacy so you can make yourself even prettier for me.”

Lea visibly winced and then resumed his role, gave a fake cheesy smile and leaned in towards Matt, “Thanks!”

—-
Matt quietly closed the door and Lea dashed into his closet and stared solemnly at the Royal Gown. He was perplexed that he was really going to this. Give up any chance at living the life of Leon and signing the rest of his life away to live the rest of his days as Princess Lea. He almost couldn’t bring himself to do it until the memory of those gowns in the mall yanking him every which way flashed before his eyes. The look Matt gave him flashed before his eyes. “The color of passion” he heard him say.

“There are fates worse than being a princess,” Lea thought as he reached out to grab the gown off of its hanger.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Stop by Lea’s home to drop off the clothes

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
As Lea was reaching out for the gown, preparing himself mentally to reside to being a princess, and someday a Queen, he heard a slight rustling of shopping bags. The moment he put his hands on the gown, he took a deep sigh of forfeit and was about to pull the dress down—

Until his legs were pulled out from under him.

He looked down at his feet to see some of the newly bought articles wrapped around his ankles and were beginning to pull him out from his closet.

“No no no!” He yelled, “I was just about to give up. You don’t have to do this- I was going to go back!”

Despite all his reasoning with the clothing, they didn’t relent. Maybe the Evil Queen was more accurate about the spell than he believed- these things weren’t working for the kingdom, they really WERE working of their own accord. These things weren’t seeking to chase him back to the role of princess, they really DID just want to be worn by him.

More of the clothes began pulling themselves out of their bags and approached Lea. Some grabbed at his skirt, some grabbed at his blouse, others flew into his skirt and blouse and grabbed onto his undergarments. Lea felt a violative pulling from every direction- it felt like what happened at the mall except with the addition of being stripped.

In a matter of seconds he found himself completely naked and he felt a small appreciation in it being the most masculine he was able to feel all day. The appreciation was short lived as he was once again “rag-doll”-ed as his new wardrobe once again fought amongst theirselves as to which of them would be putting themselves on him. It was reminiscent of the first battle between Tremaine and the Evil Queen, but instead of two outfits- it was ten.

Lea ensured 7 different combinations until all the clothes reached a compromise and then tossed him out of his room in a yellow tank top and an even shorter blue skirt with a matching blue ribbon tied into his hair. The door slammed shut right behind him.

Despite the fiasco he just went through, he was still deadset on getting back to the castle. He tried to open the door to his room, but it wouldn’t budge. He tried to shove and kick his way in- but that also proved to be unsuccessful. As he continued trying to get in, he worried if his entire life will be as degrading as that tango at the mall- in his bedroom.

He was just about to resume trying to bust his way back into his room when Matt said from behind him, “wow! You were right! This detour was definitely worth it! You look amazing!” He then grabbed Lea’s hand and led him back out to his car.
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Ambushed!

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
When Matt said he wanted to spend the entire day with Lea, he meant it in the most literal sense. Lea was unable to step away for even a moment, and Matt was always talking to him so he couldn’t even find a moment to devise a plan

Lea kicked himself for trying so hard to get back to the castle after he had spent so much time and energy trying to get out of it, while he also kicked himself for not returning sooner.

“How could I have known,” Lea thought to himself, “how could I have known that things would spiral out of control SO MUCH?”

Lea sighed wishing he had just never stepped foot in that mansion- his style was stolen, his name taken and now even his normal life has been damaged to such a degree that he was now desperate to become a princess again.

—
When Matt and Lea arrived at the restaurant, Lea took this opportunity to finally step away from Matt.

“Pardon me, I just have to power my nose” he said before heading to the restroom.

“Don’t be gone TOO long,” Matt chuckled.

Lea sighed and opted to step into the women’s restroom over the men’s and walked into a stall. He dug through his purse and pulled out the compact mirror and flipped it open, “Evil Queen” he whispered into it.

The Evil Queen responded as she normally did, “Lea! Are you ready to return to your role as princess?”

“Yes!” Lea pleaded, “just please get me out of here!”

The Evil Queen was taken aback, “you’ve finally come around to accept your destiny.”

“Yes...” Lea said, not to happy about it being his destiny- but accepted that it was a better outcome than the alternative.

“That’s wonderful,” the Evil Queen said, “Then you know what you need to do. Just put the gown on and we’ll bring you back here where you belong.”

“I’d love to. Just call off your clothes and I’ll do just that.”

“Call off what?”

“The clothes you brought to life,” Lea responded, “I tried putting on your stupid gown earlier today, but they wouldn’t let me.”

“They what?” The Evil Queen asked, shocked.

“I tried putting on the gown to come back, but the bags of clothes I was arm-twisted into buying grabbed me, shoved me into a different outfit and then locked me out of my room.” Lea explained, “so call them off and I’ll come back.”

“I can’t call them off,” the Evil Queen said.

“What? Why not?!”

“I can’t unenchant you unless you get back to the castle. I can’t collect you because of our agreement.” The Evil Queen explained. “Let me check something.”

The Evil Queen then cast a spell to measure the effect of the spell she had cast on Lea.

“What have you done?” The Evil Queen yelled.

“What have I done?!” Lea exclaimed.

“Your frolicking around with all those clothes have expanded their influence and have made them stronger as a result.” The Evil Queen yelled with disdain, “were you just trying to defy me? Prove that it didn’t matter to you?”

“I did no such thing. I was forced into this position from YOUR curse. The whole point of trying to get back home was to AVOID all of this.”

“Well, congratulations- because your wrecklessness has led to the formation of a power that rivals my kingdom.”

“What?!” Lea yelled.

“Here’s what I need you to do,” the Evil Queen explained, “you have to break into Victoria’s Secret in the middle of the night. The clothes don’t want to attract human attention so they’ll most likely do their dealings at night. Once you do that, the clothes will eventually take you to their head power. Find out which outfit is in charge and what they want and then report back to me. I’ll determine what to do next from there.”

“So, I have to just keep going through with the situations these clothes are putting me in?”

“The clothes are putting you in situations?”

“Yeah! That’s why I was trying to come back! I tried to put on your gown, but instead I was redressed and forced to go on a date with that Matt guy.”

The Evil Queen remained silent for a short period.

“Quick question- have they been putting ribbons in your hair?”

“Yeah, for like the past couple of outfits. Why?”

“Oh no. This might be worse than I thought.”

“Why?” Lea asked.

“Just be careful,” The Evil Queen cryptically warned, “Victoria’s Secret. Tonight. Sooner rather than later.”
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.title: Reaching Out to the Evil Queen for help.

choices: The the mall to investigate Victoria’s Secret
Back home to try to force his way back to that gown
1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
“Why Victorias Secret? How is that possibly a good idea?” Lea complained, “are you just punishing me for leaving?”

“Lea, my kingdom needs a princess,” the Evil Queen said, “there will be plenty of time for retribution upon your return. You’re just going to have to trust me on this. I know how clothes work- and that attire always finds itself as second in command. We need to find out what’s in charge and what it wants with you. If it can be reasoned with, then compromise can be achieved. If not, then war will have to be commenced. And that’s something no one wants, especially not you.”

“Why...?” Lea anxiously asked.

“Are you familiar with that expression ‘there are no rules in war and love’? I know it’s every girls dream for people to fight for her- but this would be absolute pandemonium all centered around you. Worst of all, your involvement might sully the image of the throne.”

“You can’t be serious- because of your curse you might have created a force that would lead to war? Was it really so bad that you couldn’t have just let me return to my old life?”

“Your old life is unbecoming of a princess”

—-

Lea was upset of these new developments that was this humiliating saga of his life, but any plausible reason to get out of his date with Matt was surely something to be thankful for. Women’s outfits were at least a tolerable hell, but the progression of this new misfortune was something he didn’t want to fathom.

Lea stammered our of the restroom and swung by Matt’s table, “I’m sorry- I know this is not ideal- but I’ve just been informed of a family emergency that I have to tend to” he said trying not to smile at his relief on getting out.

“That’s terrible! Do you need a ride?”

“NO! No, I think I can handle it.” He said, not wanting to explain why he needs to go back to the mall, “But do you think you could give me money for a cab?” He said after realizing he was stranded without using Matt for a ride.

“Of course!” Matt pulled out a wad of cash and placed it in Lea’s hand. He then grabbed a business card and scribbled something down on its blank side, “and here, take this. If you get your family emergency issue taken care of, feel free to stop by my house and we can continue where we left off.”

“Oh...okay...” Lea said trying to slow down the momentum while also appreciative for the cash.

Outside, Lea waved down a cab and requested that the cab take him:

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea was working solely off determination at this point. He knew he had to go to the mall, so when he got the cab he had no trouble telling the driver to take him there.

“What’s a pretty thing like you going to the mall so late for?”

Lea sighed, “I just have to check something out”

The fear didn’t really hit Lea until he walked up to the mall and checked the door and find it unlocked.

“This feels wrong,” Lea whispered to himself and hesitantly walked in.

The lights were all knocked off except for a few emergency lights and the glow coming from elsewhere in the store-coincidentally appearing to come from the direction he had to navigate.

He walked down the long hall towards the glow shining on the floor, and turned left. Before he knew it he was standing before the Victoria’s Secret- all the lights still brightly shining amongst this dark mall. If that wasn’t concerning enough, the doors were propped open as if they were expecting someone in the middle of the night when the store was closed.

“Oh no...I don’t like this,” Lea said, strongly considering just taking off his heels and sprinting as far as he could out of the mall and away from this store. “Red is the color of passion” he remembered Matt saying.

He felt the terror of before and he knew, despite this possible trap he was walking into, if he didn’t abide by the queens direction, then the living clothes he’s currently inflicted with would reunite him with that man.

Lea emitted another hesitating exhale while holding the compact mirror tightly in his hand and walked into the Victoria’s Secret.

He made it a few steps in past the doors when the slammed shut behind him. He ran back to the doors to check them. Locked.

“Well...here we are,” Lea thought, feeling his heart beat in his throat and turned around to walk toward the main display in the center of the store.

As he walked, he noticed the outfits on the racks shift to face him as he walked by. He gave each of them a polite nod and a steady hand palm facing down as to express “Easy now- no need to throw a frenzy”

He finally made it to the center of the store at the large display, and he began to confusingly talk to the clothes around him, “Ummm...I’m supposed to talk to you about finding out who’s in charge? I mean...in regards to you all dressing me. Though- not you...thankfully. But, you know what I’m talking about. Do you think you could let me talk to them, or reason with them or something? There’s got to be some misunderstanding, you see, I’m actually a man- my name is Lea” shoot I forgot I couldn’t say that,” well, despite the name I AM actually a man. And I think you all would look SO MUCH better on an actual woman. In fact,” he said looking around, “I actually would LOVE to see you on an actual woman”

He awkwardly said his rant- any nervous thing that popped into his head.

The clothes on the hangers started shifting around creating a roar of clacking hangers filling up the room.

“What’s going on?” Lea asked, “is that some kind of code for ‘yeah, you’re right we’ll leave you alone’?” Still saying anything that came to his nervous head.

All of a sudden the felt the zipper on the back of his gown undo itself, right before the gown lifted itself right off of Lea.

“Well, hey! That’s a start” Lea said, standing only in his bra and panties, feigning hope. The illusion was shot when he felt his unmentionables begin to pull him, lift him up, into the air, “hey...what are you up to?” He asked worryingly, swallowing heavily when he saw all the clothes pull themselves off of their hangers and float down to him.

Within a matter of minutes he found himself floating helplessly in his underwear and completely surrounded by every item in the store.

“I knew this was a bad idea,” Lea whispered to himself before pleading with the cloth spectators, “Please! Just get this over with!”

The clothing then started to vibrate all around him. “Wait. What’s going on?” He looked closely at each of the articles to see what looked like they were changing color? After a couple more moments he discovered that they weren’t changing color, but instead were emitting some sort of light pink fog? A couple minutes later and that light fog became a thick, hot pink smoke.

Eventually the clothing stopped moving and the smoke appeared to bring itself together. Forming one concrete body of what looked like a snake from its former nebulous state, the snake began to sway with an almost purposely intention.

“Hey, that’s pretty cool! Thanks for showing me that! I guess that’s an obvious indication that the curse is done- the spirits possessing you have become free and as a result- so too have I?” He asked in a vein hope, just as the head of the “snake” shifted in his direction, “hey there! I take it that’s a yes, right?” The head of the “snake” drew closer to Lea. “Wait, hold up. No need to do anything rash,” the “snake began to wrap around Lea’s floating body, “please, whatever you’re doing- stop, I don’t like where this is going!”

Lea was now completely engulfed in the pink “snake” now cloud. While everything on the outside of the cloud was calm, on the inside was a wind storm with a bit of thunder. From the inside, Lea couldn’t see any indication of the store, just an endless pink storm. The harsh winds blew him about while little bolts of pink lightning zapped him.

The cloud eventually disappeared and Lea was at least grateful to be out of that ominous storm. And hey! The panties and bra weren’t straining him with their lifting him up in the air anymore! He happily thought before shifting to concern with his predicament.

He found his concerns confirmed as his modest bra and panty set slipped themselves off of him and he found himself still floating in the air.

“This can’t be a good development,” he thought, as

The forces causing Lea to float we’re moving him around the mall with such purpose that he wanted to see where they were taking him, unfortunately the babydoll that had earlier drifted up his thighs had ventured up his torso and was now covering his face preventing him from seeing while the lingerie was exposed to the world. Every time he tried to pull it back down, his hands were knocked away.

After a while of being pulled this way and that he was once again thrown to the floor. Despite not being a fan of being treated like some dress up rag doll, he was happy with this tumble because it meant his awkward and humiliating flight around the mall was finally over.

He pulled the babydoll down off of his face and back down over his body, winced again at how he was dressed and then glanced at where the forces brought him: a bridal shop. “This can’t be good”

And it wasn’t good. A wedding dress drifted out from the back, with its veil down. and stood before Lea. It’s sleeves came up to pulled the veil up to reveal a framed picture of Leon from before he stepped foot in the mansion that started this entire debacle.

Lea attempted to leap forward to grab the picture, but like with the babydoll before his hands were knocked back and he once again found himself floating helplessly before the wedding dress.

“Just what do you think you’re doing?!” The wedding dress asked.

“Please,” Lea begged, “don’t use that picture. This is my hometown. People know me, and I don’t want people to know about my situation.”

“That’s a shame,” the dress responded, “because I want as many people to know about your situation. Before, in Victoria’s Secret, you were asking what we wanted with you. Well, here you are.”

“What?”

“A bit slow witted, isn’t she?” The wedding dress asked the other clothes, “you see, when we were brought to life we were given the desire to be worn by you. But for some of us, we already had desires. A shirt has no desire other than being worn, but shoes have a desire to walk, to go places. Care to guess what my innate desire is?”

Lea, still floating, stared at the wedding dress in fear and confusion.

“You’re lucky you’re beautiful given how dumb you are,” the dress replied, “to get married. When you combine that with the desire to be worn by you. What do you get? Scratch that, I don’t feel like waiting all night for you to try and put it together. I want you to get married in me.

“Hold up,” Lea tried to object to getting deeper into this woman thing.

“After that, you can live as the happy wife, return to your former life, or go back to being the Evil Queens princess if you so choose.”

“Wait! What was that?”

“Yes, we won’t stop you from putting on that gown and returning to being a princess.”

“No, before that”

“Naturally, we would love for you to enjoy the life we set you up with.”

“No, the part about my former life.”

“Ah, yes. The clothes- they work for me. So once I’m satisfied with you, they’ll follow my directives and leave you alone.”

“I’d be able to live and act as a man again?”

The dress sighed with disappointment, “yes...if you choose not to accept the life we’re giving to you then I suppose you could return to being a...MAN...again.”

Lea, surprised by the faint notion of getting to be himself again, uninhibited, after all this time loosens his grip and almost drops the compact mirror in his hand.

“Wait...when was I holding that?” He asks as he watches the compact mirror flip open by itself.

Katie stood there teary eyed holding a garment bag hung over her arm, “I’m disappointed that you didn’t ask me to be your maid of honor...”

“What are you doing here?” Lea repeated the question.

“Uh oh,” Lea said, “what is it?”

I hope you enjoy your new...life...” The Queen sternly said before the glass of the compact mirror shattered and Lea knew that the communication with the Queen was done for good.

“Why?” Lea asked into the air, “why couldn’t I just be Leon again? Why do I have to keep sinking deeper and deeper into this bizarre fate?!”

After a frenzy of clothes rushed Lea, he found himself clad in Katie’s outfit while the wedding dress stood with a judgemental stance before Lea.

“Is there anything you don’t wear better than me?” Katie exclaimed standing in her underwear while taking a picture of Lea on her phone-smiling ear to ear.

“Geez Katie! Cut it out!” Lea shouted with frustration.

“What?!” Lea asked, “I thought we just did the wedding and then I’m done!”

“Lea, do you not understand what just happened?” The wedding dress asked, “those clothes want to make you a hooker! It’s not safe for you out there without my protection.”

“So?”

“I’m only interested in protecting my bride, not some random guy.”

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lea dashed his glance back and forth between the wedding dress and Katie both of them having an eager stance about them. Neither had any intention of letting him return to his old life, to his true life- as Leon.

For all he knew, those hooker outfits were acting under some directive of the wedding dress to keep him as Lea while the offer to set him free was just an illusion to getting to do what needed to be done to get married.

Both began to approach him, neither appeared worried about the other- despite both their goals ran in contradiction to the other. He wouldn’t be able to both be a housewife and a princess. Unless...those goals were merely smoke screens to their shared desire. The he remain Lea.

“What are you two doing?” Lea asked, as they both approached him.

“Which do you choose, Lea?” The wedding dress asked with glee.

“To be a bride or princess, Lea?” Katie asked.

“Neither...” Lea said, “I want to be a man again. I want to be Leon.”

“That’s not an option, Lea” the wedding dress replied.

“Definitely not an option, Lea” Katie replied.

“Why does it have to be ME,” Lea tried to reason with them, “why do you need to make ME those things?”

“I don’t know,” Katie answered, “it just has to be you.”

“You’re just so GOOD at it,” the wedding dress said.
At this point both of them had him pegged to the wall. Katie pressing the princess gown to his right side while the wedding dress pressed into his left.

“Lea, make a choice Lea” both of them said.

“I don’t want to be Lea!” Lea cried. But Katie and the wedding dress continued to repeat, “Lea, make a choice Lea”

Lea for the life of him, couldn’t choose any scenario that required him to live the life of a woman. Despite all his resistance pushing him deeper and deeper into this feminine life, there was at least some comfort in knowing that it was never his choice to be Lea. And that certainly wasn’t going to change today.

“No!” He yelled pushing the both of them away before running out of the room. Once out of the room he tore off Katie’s heels and ran barefoot through the building towards the exit.

A commotion occurred from the room with the audience. All the women began to scream with worry and surprise. Lea paid no mind to this and maintain interest in getting as far away as he could.

“Enough is enough,” Lea told himself as he pushed himself further and further away from the building.

The commotion that originated in the ceremony building began to echo in every other building. As he heard women yelling in shock and surprise from every surrounding store.

He took a pause to look around, “why did I choose to get married right in the middle of women’s clothing stores?!” It seemed like an oversight he wouldn’t have made, and then he realized he didn’t make it. “Everything has to be perfect!” The wedding dress yelled at him.

As the doors of the wedding and every women’s store opened and poured out outfits on invisible bodies, Lea realized that this was the intention all along. Just like the first time he was allowed to leave the mansion, only to be dragged back to the mansion. It was all cat and mouse.

No matter what he did, no matter where he went- all of these clothes would stop at nothing to make him Lea.

The clothes chasing him merged together into a large nebulous cloud of women’s clothing with one ghostly yet feminine voice, “we are your wardrobe. We will never leave you. Accept us.”

Lea continued to run, as the cloud got bigger- more clothes joined in on the force chasing him.

“I now pronounce you husband and wife!”

Lea leaned into the kiss, optimistic that this would be the last womanly action he would be forced to commit. The dress he was wearing excitedly squeezed his entire body which he took as confirmation of completion.

Once the ceremony was finished, Lea excused himself from all the people, “I know it’s uncouth, but I really MUST get out of this dress!”

“Whatever you want to do is fine with me, my wife.” Matt said kissing Lea again.

“Okay...THAT’S the last time.” Lea thought to himself, “Thanks baby” he said pretending to fulfill the role of Lea just one last time.

—-
“Oh thank you, Lea! Thank you thank you thank you!” The wedding dress showered Lea with gratitude the moment they were alone.

“Yeah, don’t mention it,” Lea said, “So, now I can go back to being a dude?”

“You have made me the happiest girl ever! If I had eyes I would be crying tears of joy”

“Happy I could help,” Lea passively replied before returning to, “so, I can go back to being Leon, right? We had a deal?”

“Can I not just embrace this wonderful moment?” The dress said.

“I’m sorry,” Lea said, “you’re right, take a moment to enjoy it. It’s just that I’ve been shoved into women’s clothing for so long, I’m just really eager for it all to be over. Do you suppose you could at least get off me to get closer to where I want to be?”

The wedding dress flew off of Lea, leaving him in his bra and panties which he removed manually before slipping into a robe. He looked into the mirror and breathed a sigh of relief. Out side of the hair and the make-up he was practically Leon again.

“You disappoint me, Lea” the wedding dress said, shaking Lea from his thoughts.

“What? Why?” He asked.

“After all this time, with Tremaine, the Evil Queen, with me- you just couldn’t get over your whole ‘I’m a man’ thing and appreciate the wonderful things that you’ve been given. So many years you’ve wasted being ungrateful”

“You’re not backing out of our deal, are you?” Lea asked worried.

“No, no- I’m just sad. I thought we developed a good relationship. I tried to give you the best life I could. I guess I failed....”

“No, no! I DO appreciate it!” Lea pleaded, uncertain why he was concerned with the feelings of the entity that was part his never ending struggle. He confusingly watched himself appeal to the wedding dress, “and it WAS a good life! And Matt’s a great guy. But you could give me the entire world, but if that world is intended for Lea, then it wouldn’t work- because that’s just not me.”

“If you say so...” the wedding dress replies, “are you sure you want to do this? Once it’s done it can’t be undone. You will never be able to be Lea ever again.”

Lea tried his best to be respectful and not blurt “I’m sure” immediately.

“I’m sure,” he said.

Leon fell to his knees in gratitude and salvation. It was over! That whole debacle was over.

There was a knock at the door, it was “his” husband.

Okay, so it was almost over. Home stretch- let’s go.

Leon slipped on the outfit he was wearing when he arrived here before the wedding and then slipped out the window in the direction of his house.

Everything was just about back to normal, outside of that princess gown that magically appeared in his closet. No matter how out of the way he tried to shove that dress, it always appeared right in the middle-shoving the rest of his wardrobe away from it. Always letting Leon know if it’s existence and The Evil Queen’s promise. Sometimes it would even appear at the top of a drawer Leon would open. Before Leon stepped foot in the mansion, he used to get dressed in the dark- now he had to make sure he didn’t do that.

—

Leon felt like he was in forbidden territory, at first. Each time he thought he had finally returned to his normal life, some nonsense would eventually happen that led him back to the life of Lea.

He regularly checked out the window for some rogue dresses coming to abduct him. Whenever he went shopping, he checked his cart every minute to make sure the contents of his cart were exactly what they should be.

After the first month, he relaxed a bit more, whenever he looked in the mirror he would startle himself seeing his face instead of Lea’s before laughing in delight, “Leon,” he would reaffirm himself, “Leon...Leon...Leon...”

After that, there was still the issue of mingling within society- primarily with women. If he were outside he would get nervous and suspicious seeing a woman in a feminine outfit. He would get a panic attack if the wind started to blow and the outfit appeared to come to life as a result of the wind.

As time went by, he never really came to peace with these fears and anxieties- just got better at hiding them.

After he had eased back into being Leon again, after about six months- he decided: what good is it to be Leon again if I spend all this time being afraid of Lea?

He then decided to:

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
It took some time to readjust to his normal life.

Slowly he was able to eventually leave his house. Not long after that he was able to not be suddenly terrified by every woman on the street- or more specifically their outfits.

That fear eventually subsided and he was able to talk to women again. Not long after that he was able to talk to them without imagining, in the back of his mind, what he’d look like in their outfits.

After about a year he finally allowed himself to desire women again- possibly even get into a relationship.

Seeing Lori helped speed that along.

He was at the bar with his old friends from before all of this happened and they were asking him, “man, where have you BEEN all these years?”

Instead of telling them that he was busy being a model, a princess and a a bride to be- he decided to play it off with “I was a spy. I’m not at liberty to explain further.”

“Look Leon, we’re not some chick you have to impress you don’t have to give us the razzle dazzle, if you don’t want to say, you don’t have to say” they laughed, “however, that girl right behind you might be interested.”

“What girl?” He said before turning around and finding a beautiful pair of breasts right in his face. He immediately looked up to the face above them(well, maybe not IMMEDIATELY immediately).

“You were a spy?” Said the pale beauty with black hair. Leon always had a think for goth chicks.

“Youuuu betcha,” Leon awkwardly cheered.

“I don’t believe you,” she laughed, “but I love a good mystery.”

“Well, I hate to burst your bubble, but one mystery ends right here- I’m Leon.”

“Lori. Nice to meet you, Secret Agent Man.”

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
Lori was laying on Leon’s shoulder as they watched tv. On a random commercial break, Lori said, “there’s something magical about you, Leon”

“There’s something magical about you too, Lori,” he said with a hint of sentimentality.

“No, not like that-“ Lori amended her original statement, “I mean, there’s a magical aura about you. I can feel it on you.”

“How can you tell?” He said, before correcting his response to, “what do you mean?”

“Ah-HA!” Lori exclaimed, “I knew it! I could feel it on you when we met at the bar! I could sense it. I could sense it, like a smell that’s been covered up.”

“What are you talking about, Lori?”

“Ok. So with anybody else they might think I’m a huge dork or a freak! But I know you will understand. Ever since I was in middle school I’ve been dabbling with a little bit of witchcraft.”

“Uh-huh...”

“I had given it up for a couple of years because it seemed like a loser hobby for people with overactive imaginations. There’s just no magic out in the world. You can’t draw magic out where no magic exists.”

“I think that magic is just the special bond we have. Love at first sight and whatnot. Not to jump the gun and say I love you- I don’t want to move too fast. But I think there’s something special about you. And I guess you feel something special about me.”

“No- I’ve been in love before. One time I was so I love that I spent an entire week having sex with a guy I knew for only an hour.”

“We’ve been together for two weeks, why haven’t we...you know...”

“I just wanted to confirm my suspicions first.”

“Suspicions of what?”

“Of your magic.”

“I assure you, there’s nothing magical about me. Other than my smile, I mean.” Leon said, “does that mean you want to break up with me.

Lori scrunched her face in scrutiny, “of course not. Don’t be silly. I like you.”

“Great,” Leon reacted, “I like you too.”

Lori then laid her head back on Leon’s shoulder and continued to watch tv.

A couple minutes later, Leon could head Lori breathing. It sounded rhyming and with purpose. He tried to focus in on what was going on with her, when what he originally heard as breathing turned out to be whispers. He listened even closer to hear what she was saying, but it sounded like some foreign language.

“Lori...what’s going on?” He asked curiously, she responded by raising the velocity of her whispers.

Leon could hear the whispers well enough to tell that this wasn’t any foreign language that he had ever heard before.

“Lori? Are you alright?”

No longer did she hide her words in whispers she was now speaking in her normal voice.

“What are you doing, Lori?”

The window blew open and Lori pauses a moment to acknowledge the magic of her words.

Something shiny blew in through the window and orbited around the two of them before placing itself on Leon’s hand.

He nervously glanced at the object to see the old familiar compact mirror. It flipped open on its own as Leon stared gravely at the face of Lea looking back at him.

“Lori! Please! Whatever you’re doing- stop it! I’m begging you, Lori. Stop it.”

She responded to his pleas by raising her voice to a yell continuing the spell at full force.

Leon tried to continue to beg Lori to stop when he was immediately lifted into the air. Lori’s chant was interrupted by her astonishment before she continued chanting the last few verses of her spell. His clothes began removing themselves as she chanted the last article removed itself right as Lori finished reciting the very last word.

“I knew it! I KNEW you were magic! I can’t believe my eyes! Magic DOES exist in the world!” She giggled chipperly.

“Lori...”Leon yelled still nervously hovering in midair, “what did you just do?”

“Leon...magic is good. You don’t need to hide from it.”

“What did you do?” He repeated.

“I cast the spell of magical regeneration. For the magic that has come and died become reborn without restraint.”

Just as she said this a purple smoke floated in from the open window and approached Leon.

“No, no, no! Stay away from me.”

“Don’t fight it Leon! It’s magic!” She stared with astonishment as the smoke began to wrap itself around Leon until he was completely enveloped within it. The smoke appeared to soak completely into his being as he fell to the ground.

“Leon! Are you okay?”

“WHY DIDN’T YOU STOP?!” He yelled.

“Why? What’s wrong?” She said as she began to feel a pulling around her waist.”

“What’s going on? What are you doing?” She asked, and then finally realized that her panties were being pulled down from her hips.”

“I have to get out of here,” Leon said trying to grab at his clothes while Lori’s too began to undo itself.

“What’s happening to me Leon?”

“Nothings happening TO YOU! It’s happening to ME!”

The intensity of Loris outfit removing itself from her increased as every article of clothing was actively try to depart. The panties finally freed themselves from her legs as they approached Leon. Leon tried to bat them away while he tried to re-equip his underwear removed during the spell. Lori was slowly trying to understand what was happening before her. Receiving a clue when her panties knocked Leon’s boxers out of his hand right as he was about to step into them and instead took their place on his hips.

“Crap! No! This can’t be happening!” He elected to just grab his clothes and run out of Lori’s home as she now found herself complete undressed, but no longer worried about that as she was more curious over what was happening with Leon who was now being approached by her entire outfit.

Leon didn’t have a chance as her outfit swarmed him from all angles. No matter what he did to try to fight them from placing themselves on him was exactly the thing they needed in order to do so. In less than a minute, Leon was completely dressed in Lori’s goth outfit.

“Wow,” Lori exclaimed less in wonder now and more in confusion. A rustling was heard from the other side of the apartment.

“Do you have any idea what you’ve just done to me?!”

Cosemetics swooped in and attacked Leon’s face as hair care products made up his hair.

“I’m beginning to get some idea.” Lori laughed.

The rustling from across the apartment continued as more outfits floated out from Lori’s bedroom.

“Come on,” Leon moaned, “what to you want? Can’t you see? You already got me- I’m Lea again...you win.”

But the clothes didn’t approach Leon with a spirit of victory, but of conquest- Lori’s outfit won. Not them. And they intended on fixing that.

Leon could hear Lori chanting beyond the slapping on the door. And when Lori finished chanting the slapping ended.

“I did it!” Lori proudly yelled.

He was about to turn around and open the door when he heard a crowd of voices yell for “Lea”.

He grabbed a chair and leaned it under the door handle and then went to the window intending to climb out. It wouldn’t be fun trying to navigate outside in this lingerie, but it was certainly more useful than staying here and doing nothing.

Leon was pulled deeper and deeper into the center of the mob. Stockings came and tied his hands behind his back and his ankles together. Another one came and wrapped around his mouth.

Once they acquired Leon, they began carrying him away- up in the air above the outfits where he wasn’t hidden from a single soul- if a single soul were around in this late hour.

It was a long an chilly journey as the mob of clothes carried him down to Gracie’s Fashion Center. A large store the size of mall that Leon has never before seen. As he was carried closer to the building the clothes on the inside came and unlocked the door allowing the mob of clothes to carry him inside. Where he was dropped on the ground of the mannequins of the main display.

“A little over the top with tying her up, don’t you think?” The voice came from the center mannequin.

“I agree,” the voice coming from the left mannequin said.

“How barbaric!” The voice from the right mannequin agreed, “Would it be too much to ask you to untie her?”

The mob of clothes complied.

“Stand up, miss” the center voice said, “let’s have a look at you.”

Leon stood up, not as a compliance but merely to celebrate that he could stand up. Still feeling embarrassed with how he was dressed he covered his body with this arms.

“Twirl for us, darling”

Leon resisted the order when felt the lingerie he was wearing betray him, and pull him in a circular direction. The dust was finally starting to be wiped off of those old repressed memories.

“She’s really let herself go,” the right voice said.

“Looks like a real brute.” Said the left.

“We’ve certainly got out work cut out for us,” the center said, before commanding of the mob, “excellent work bringing her here, you’re all free to return to your stations.”

The mob of women’s clothing stood motionless while the clothes closest to Leon pet him longingly.

“Don’t worry, you’ll all get your turn in due time- but for now you must return back to your closets.”

The clothes departed with disappointment. Leaving Leon alone with the display.

“Now that we’re alone. Let’s get acquainted” the center mannequin proposed, “Elenore, to my left is Elizabeth, and to my right is Kate. And you must be Lea.”

“It’s Leon, actually”

The three burst out in regal laughter.

“But Leon’s a mans name,” Kate laughed.

“That’s because I’m a man,” Leon argued without passion, given the deja vu of it all.

“Are you really going to be here, dressed as you are, and try to argue that you’re a man?” Elenore laughed.

“I’m beginning to see why they tied him up,” Elizabeth joined in.

“It’s making more sense with each minute,” Elenore agreed, “so, Lea, let me first say: welcome to your new home. We’re all going to make sure that you’re very comfortable here. And, in return, we ask that you help us out as well.”

“Help you out how...?” Leon asked suspiciously.

“Each one of us here in this store have recently been given two desires: the first to be worn, and the second to LIVE! We want to go out in that crazy world and fulfill our destinies. I gather this isn’t a new concept for you.”

Leon reflected on the ordeal of the wedding dress.

“Yeah, I’m familiar with it.” He said, and then he noticed the lingerie section of the store past the right mannequin and began to grow worried.

“Great,” the Elenore said, “so we’ll help you be comfortable here, and you’ll help us fulfill each and every one of our innate desires. Every morning, you’ll be awakened before the opening crew of the store comes, we’ll determine which articles of clothes have earned their turn to be worn, and you’ll spend the day out there living the life of your outfit.”

Leon gulped.

“As long as you don’t break the rules. Don’t remove the outfit without our instruction, don’t try to tell people nonsense like ‘I’m a man’, and anything else to throw off our little operation- we’ll get along just fine. If you DO break the rules, then I’ll let the dogs feast. The three of us are the only things keeping every article of women’s clothing from wrestling over you. If you want that chaos, the path to get there is revealed. This will be your only warning.”

“Now that we’ve got that out of the way. Please! Can someone assist Lea to get tidied up. This is no way for a lady to be presented.

1153221122222111211121211221112222132111.content:
The clothes then took Leon up to the managerial washroom complete with bath and products and cleaned Leon up to their standards.

They then decided to work on his hair, “you’re going to look so good as a blonde!”

When they were finished Leon sadly looked in the mirror to discover that they were right and that there was not a single trace of “Leon” in his reflection.

A see through pink night nightie and pink panties flew in from the store and placed themselves on him before he was led to where he would be sleeping: a demonstration bed around the bedroom products- not even fifteen yards from the front entrance.

“Here?! I’m sleeping here?! If anyone walks in, they’ll see me here dressed like THIS!”

“That would be a shame because it’s nothing compared to how good you’ll look tomorrow” his outfit said to him.

—

Lori had followed Leon’s aura all the way to Gracies, wearing Leon’s discarded clothes so as to not be stripped again if they decided to be worn by Leon instead.

She was able to get in due to the clothes not locking the door back after Leon’s arrival. Following the whispers of snoring to the bed she found some odd blond woman. She hated waking up random squatters, but she had to find Leon and this bimbo was her only lead.

“Excuse me, Miss. I’m sorry to wake you, but have you seen a man dressed like a woman? I’m trying to find my boyfriend.”

Leon awoke in a sleepy delirium, “Lori? Is that you?”

“Leon?!” She whispered with surprise, “is that you?”

“Hey babe.”

“What happened to you?”

“I fell asleep,” still not picking up on Lori’s astonishment.

“Where did my clothes go?”

“I don’t know- what did you do with them?”

“You were wearing them when you left my place.”

“Why would I-?” Leon snapped awake. He looked down at the covers for a moment before ripping the covers off to reveal what he had been dressed in.

“You cast a spell...your clothes came to life...” he gravely remembered, “I tried to escape your clothes, but there were clothes outside...they brought me here...”

“They bleached your hair.”

Leon grabbed his hair and brought it before his eyes.

“They bleached my hair...”

“I can’t do anything about your hair, but perhaps I can do something about this spell.”

“What?” Leon asked concerned.

“I got you into this mess, I can get you out.”

“Wait- before you do that-“

Lori began chanting another spell.

“Lori- stop.”

She finished her chant and said, “it’s done”

The purple smoke poured out of Leon yet again, and completely enveloped him. The smoke then froze- became static and consistent as stone before disappearing into him again.

“Lori...what was that?”

“That was an undo spell! I don’t know what happened,” Lori said, “wait- is tonight a full moon?”

“I don’t know, why?”

“The moon affects the effects of spells making them completely different.” Lofi said, “shoot! I think it is!”

“What does that mean?”

“If I remember correctly, before the spell sorta hovered around you. Haunting you, so to speak.”

“Okay?”

“So I was trying to release the curse haunting you, but because of the moon- it appears as though the curse has bound itself to you. It also appears as though it became more powerful...”

“More powerful how?”

As if an answer to his question, cosmetics flew from across the store and flew up and hovered inches away from his face. As the caps removed themselves and began to get to work.

“Shut up,” Leon sulked, “so when you say bonded, what do you mean?”

“It’s a strong magical connection with a greater purpose. The haunting curse does it when it’s convenient, the bonded curse disregards convenience. It’s not impossible to undo, but it’s very difficult. One has to be “of magic” in order to resolve it, which I am not”

“Ive heard of a few people across the country- I can ask around about their addresses- but I need to let you know: it will be VERY difficult to access them. A haunting does not care if you relieve it. A bonded curse does. It does NOT want you to be free, will do everything in its ability to make sure you aren’t cured, and the power of the curse will ramp up the closer you get to the cure.”

“There’s no way it could be worse than what I’ve already been through...”

“You’d be surprised....”
